Text

A small , shiny , pink card lay on the round table in [[Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia 's sitting - room]175-sylvia bailey 's sitting - room at [the Hôtel de l'Horloge in [Paris]1-paris]176-the hôtel de l'horloge in paris . [She]67-sylvia had become quite accustomed to finding one or more cards — cards from [dressmakers]177-dressmakers , cards from [corset - makers]178-corset - makers , cards from [hairdressers]179-hairdressers — lying on [her]67-sylvia sitting - room table , but there had never been a card quite like this card . Although it was pink , it looked more like a visiting - card than [a tradesman]180-a tradesman 's advertisement , and [she]67-sylvia took it up with some curiosity . It was inscribed " [Madame Cagliostra]68-madame cagliostra , "[67-sylvia] and underneath the name were written the words " Diseuse de la Bonne Aventure , "[67-sylvia] and then , in a corner , in very small black letters , the address , " 5 , [Rue Jolie]7-the rue jolie , [Montmartre]3-montmartre . "[181-a fortune - teller] [A fortune - teller]181-a fortune - teller 's card ? What an extraordinary thing ! Like [many pretty , prosperous , idle women]182-many pretty , prosperous , idle women , [Sylvia]69-sylvia was rather superstitious . Not long before this , [her]69-sylvia first visit to [Paris]1-paris , [a [London]4-london acquaintance]183-a london acquaintance had taken [her]69-sylvia to see [a noted palmist named " [Pharaoh]70-pharaoh , "[183-a london acquaintance] in [Bond Street]5-bond street]184-a noted palmist named " pharaoh , " in bond street . [She]69-sylvia had paid [her]69-sylvia guinea willingly enough , but the result had vaguely disappointed [her]69-sylvia , and [she]69-sylvia had had the feeling , all the time [she]69-sylvia was with [him]184-a noted palmist named " pharaoh , " in bond street , that [the man]185-the man was not really reading [her]69-sylvia hand . True , " [Pharaoh]70-pharaoh "[186-the palmist] had told [her]69-sylvia [she]69-sylvia was going abroad , and at that time [she]69-sylvia had no intention of doing so . [The palmist]186-the palmist had also told [her]69-sylvia — and this was really rather curious — that [she]69-sylvia would meet , when abroad , [a foreign woman who would have a considerable influence on [her]69-sylvia life]187-a foreign woman who would have a considerable influence on her life . Well , in this very Hôtel de l'Horloge [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey had come across [a Polish lady , named [Anna Wolsky]72-anna , who was , like [Sylvia]69-sylvia [herself]69-sylvia]188-a polish lady , named anna wolsky , who was , like sylvia herself , [a young widow]189-a young widow , and [the two]190-the two had taken a great fancy to [one another]191-one another . It was most unlikely that [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky would have the slightest influence on [her]69-sylvia , [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia 's , life , but at any rate it was very curious coincidence . " [Pharaoh]70-pharaoh "[69-sylvia] had proved to be right as to these two things — [she]69-sylvia had come abroad , and [she]69-sylvia had formed a friendship with [a foreign woman]192-a foreign woman . [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey was still standing by the table , and still holding the pink card in [her]71-mrs. bailey hand , when [[her]71-mrs. bailey new friend]193-her new friend came into [the room]194-the room . " Well ? "[72-anna] said [Anna Wolsky]72-anna , speaking English with a strong foreign accent , but still speaking it remarkably well , " Have [you]67-sylvia yet decided , [[my]67-sylvia dear]2500-my dear , what [we]2501-we shall do this afternoon ? There are a dozen things open to [us]2501-we , and [I]67-sylvia am absolutely at [your]67-sylvia service to do any one of them ! "[67-sylvia] [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia laughingly shook [her]67-sylvia head . " [I]67-sylvia feel lazy , "[67-sylvia] [she]67-sylvia said . " [I]67-sylvia 've been at [the Bon Marché]2502-the bon marché ever since nine o'clock , and [I]67-sylvia feel more like having a rest than going out again , though it does seem a shame to stay in a day like this ! "[67-sylvia] The windows were wide open , the June sun was streaming in , and on the light breeze was borne the murmur of the traffic in [the Avenue de l'Opéra]195-the avenue de l'opéra , within a few yards of [the quiet street where the Hôtel de l'Horloge]196-the quiet street where the hôtel de l'horloge is situated . [The other woman]197-the other woman — [Anna Wolsky]72-anna was some years older than [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia — smiled indulgently . " [Tiens]74-tiens ! "[197-the other woman] [she]197-the other woman cried suddenly , " what have [you]67-sylvia got there ? "[197-the other woman] and [she]197-the other woman took the pink card out of [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's hand . " [Madame Cagliostra]68-madame cagliostra ? "[197-the other woman] [she]197-the other woman repeated , musingly . " Now where did [I]197-the other woman hear that name ? Yes , of course it was from [[our]2503-our chambermaid]2504-our chambermaid ! [Cagliostra]68-madame cagliostra is [a friend of [hers]2504-our chambermaid]2505-a friend of hers , and , according to [her]2504-our chambermaid , [a marvellous person]2506-a marvellous person — one from whom [the devil keeps no secrets]2507-the devil keeps no secrets ! [She]2504-our chambermaid charges only five francs for a consultation , and it appears that [all sorts of well - known people]2508-all sorts of well - known people go to [her]2504-our chambermaid , even those whom [the Parisians]75-the parisians call [the Gratin]76-the gratin , that is , the Upper Crust , from [the Champs Elysées]2509-the champs elysées and [the Faubourg St. Germain]6-the faubourg st. germain ! "[197-the other woman] " [I]67-sylvia do n't think much of [fortune - tellers]2510-fortune - tellers , "[67-sylvia] said [Sylvia]67-sylvia , thoughtfully . " [I]67-sylvia went to one last time [I]67-sylvia was in [London]4-london and [he]2510-fortune - tellers really did n't tell [me]67-sylvia anything of the slightest interest . "[67-sylvia] [Her]67-sylvia conscience pricked [her]67-sylvia a little as [she]67-sylvia said this , for " [Pharaoh]70-pharaoh "[67-sylvia] had certainly predicted a journey which [she]67-sylvia had then no intention of taking , and a meeting with [a foreign woman]192-a foreign woman . Yet here [she]67-sylvia was in [Paris]1-paris , and here was [the foreign woman]199-the foreign woman standing close to [her]67-sylvia ! Nay more , [Anna Wolsky]72-anna had become — it was really rather odd that it should be so — [the first intimate friend of [her]67-sylvia own]200-the first intimate friend of her own sex [Sylvia]67-sylvia had made since [she]67-sylvia was [a grown - up woman]201-a grown - up woman . " [I]73-madame wolsky do believe in [fortune - tellers]2510-fortune - tellers , "[73-madame wolsky] said [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky deliberately , " and that being so [I]73-madame wolsky shall spend [my]73-madame wolsky afternoon in going up to [Montmartre]3-montmartre , to [the Rue Jolie]7-the rue jolie , to hear what [this Cagliostra]68-madame cagliostra has to say . It will be what [you]2512-you in [England]8-england call ' a lark ' ! And [I]73-madame wolsky do not see why [I]73-madame wolsky should not give [myself]73-madame wolsky so cheap a lark as a five - franc lark ! "[73-madame wolsky] " Oh , if [you]202-her friend really mean to go , [I]67-sylvia think [I]67-sylvia will go too ! "[67-sylvia] cried [Sylvia]67-sylvia , gaily . [She]67-sylvia was beginning to feel less tired , and the thought of a long lonely afternoon spent indoors and by [herself]67-sylvia lacked attraction . Linking [her]67-sylvia arm through [[her]67-sylvia friend]202-her friend 's , [she]67-sylvia went [downstairs]203-downstairs and into [the barely furnished dining - room]204-the barely furnished dining - room , which was so very unlike [an English hotel dining - room]205-an english hotel dining - room . In [this dining - room]206-this dining - room the wallpaper simulated a vine - covered trellis , from out of which peeped blue - plumaged birds , and on each little table , covered by an unbleached table - cloth , stood an oil and vinegar cruet and a half - bottle of wine . [The Hôtel de l'Horloge]207-the hôtel de l'horloge was [a typical French hotel]208-a typical french hotel , and [foreigners]209-foreigners very seldom stayed [there]210-there . [Sylvia]67-sylvia had been told of [the place]211-the place by [the old French lady who had been [[her]67-sylvia governess , and who had taught [her]67-sylvia to speak French exceptionally well]213-her governess , and who had taught her to speak french exceptionally well]212-the old french lady who had been her governess , and who had taught her to speak french exceptionally well . [Several quiet Frenchmen , who had offices in [the neighbourhood]215-the neighbourhood]214-several quiet frenchmen , who had offices in the neighbourhood , were " en pension "[214-several quiet frenchmen , who had offices in the neighbourhood] at [the Hôtel de l'Horloge]207-the hôtel de l'horloge , and as [the two friends]217-the two friends came in many were the steady , speculative glances cast in [their]217-the two friends direction . To [the average Frenchman]218-the average frenchman [every woman]219-every woman is interesting ; for [every Frenchman]220-every frenchman is in love with love , and in [each fair stranger]221-each fair stranger [he]220-every frenchman sees [the possible heroine of a romance in which [he]220-every frenchman may play the agreeable part of [hero]223-hero]222-the possible heroine of a romance in which he may play the agreeable part of hero . So it was that [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia and [Anna Wolsky]72-anna both had [[their]217-the two friends silent admirers among those who lunched and dined in [the narrow green and white dining - room of [the Hôtel de l'Horloge]207-the hôtel de l'horloge]225-the narrow green and white dining - room of the hôtel de l'horloge]224-their silent admirers among those who lunched and dined in the narrow green and white dining - room of the hôtel de l'horloge . Only [a Frenchman]227-a frenchman would have given a second look at [the Polish lady]228-the polish lady while [Sylvia]67-sylvia was by , but [a Frenchman]227-a frenchman , being both [a philosopher]230-a philosopher and [a logician by nature]231-a logician by nature , is very apt to content [himself]227-a frenchman with the second - best when [he]227-a frenchman knows the best is not for [him]227-a frenchman . [The two friends]217-the two friends were in entire contrast to [one another]191-one another . [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky was tall , dark , almost swarthy ; there was a look of rather haughty pride and reserve on [her]73-madame wolsky strong - featured face . [She]73-madame wolsky dressed extremely plainly , the only ornament ever worn by [her]73-madame wolsky being a small gold horseshoe , in the centre of which was treasured — so , not long ago , [she]73-madame wolsky had confided to [Sylvia]67-sylvia , who had been at once horrified and thrilled — a piece of the rope with which [a man]234-a man had hanged [himself]234-a man at [Monte Carlo]9-monte carlo two years before ! For [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky — and [she]73-madame wolsky made no secret of the fact to [[her]73-madame wolsky new friend]193-her new friend — was [a gambler]236-a gambler . [Anna Wolsky]72-anna was never really happy , [she]72-anna did not feel more than half alive , when away from the green cloth . [She]72-anna had only left [Monte Carlo]9-monte carlo when the heat began to make [the place]211-the place unbearable to one of [her]72-anna northern temperament , and [she]72-anna was soon moving on to one of [the French watering - places]238-the french watering - places , where gambling of sorts can be indulged in all the summer through . Different in looks , in temperament , and in tastes were [the two young widows]239-the two young widows , and this , perhaps , was why [they]239-the two young widows got on so excellently well together . [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia was the foreign ideal of [a beautiful Englishwoman]240-a beautiful englishwoman . [Her]67-sylvia hair was fair , and curled naturally . [Her]67-sylvia eyes were of that blue which looks violet in the sunlight ; and [she]67-sylvia had a delicate , rose leaf complexion . Married when only nineteen to [a man much older than [herself]72-anna]241-a man much older than herself , [she]72-anna was now at twenty - five [a widow]242-a widow , and [one without any intimate duties or close ties to fill [her]72-anna existence]243-one without any intimate duties or close ties to fill her existence . Though [she]72-anna had mourned [George Bailey]77-george bailey sincerely , [she]72-anna had soon recovered all [her]72-anna normal interest and pleasure in life . [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey was fond of dress and able to indulge [her]71-mrs. bailey taste ; but , even so , good feeling and the standard of propriety of [the English country town of [Market Dalling]10-market dalling where [she]72-anna had spent most of [her]72-anna life]244-the english country town of market dalling where she had spent most of her life , perhaps also a subtle instinct that nothing else would ever suit [her]72-anna so well , made [her]72-anna remain rigidly faithful to white and black , pale grey , and lavender . [She]72-anna also wore only one ornament , but it was a very becoming and an exceedingly costly ornament , for it consisted of a string of large and finely - matched pearls . As [the two friends]217-the two friends went [upstairs]246-upstairs after luncheon [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky said earnestly , " If [I]73-madame wolsky were [you]67-sylvia , [Sylvia]67-sylvia , [I]73-madame wolsky would certainly leave [your]67-sylvia pearls in [the office]2513-the office this afternoon . Where is the use of wearing them on such an expedition as that to [a fortune - teller]181-a fortune - teller ? "[73-madame wolsky] " But why should n't [I]67-sylvia wear them ? "[67-sylvia] asked [Sylvia]67-sylvia , rather surprised . " Well , in [your]67-sylvia place [I]67-sylvia should certainly leave anything as valuable as [your]67-sylvia pearls in safe keeping . After all , [we]2515-we know nothing of this [Madame Cagliostra]68-madame cagliostra , and [Montmartre]3-montmartre is what [Parisians]2516-parisians call [an eccentric quarter]2517-an eccentric quarter . "[67-sylvia] [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia disliked very much taking off [her]67-sylvia pearls . Though [she]67-sylvia could not have put the fact into words , this string of pearls was to [her]67-sylvia a symbol of [her]67-sylvia freedom , almost of [her]67-sylvia womanhood . As [a child]247-a child and [young girl]248-young girl [she]67-sylvia had been under the close guardianship of [a stern father]249-a stern father , and it was to please [him]249-a stern father that [she]67-sylvia had married [the rich , middle - aged man at [Market Dalling]10-market dalling whose adoration [she]67-sylvia had endured rather than reciprocated]250-the rich , middle - aged man at market dalling whose adoration she had endured rather than reciprocated . [George Bailey]77-george bailey also had been [a determined man]251-a determined man — determined that [[his]77-george bailey young wife]252-his young wife should live [his]77-george bailey way , not [hers]252-his young wife . During [their]253-their brief married life [he]77-george bailey had heaped on [her]67-sylvia showy , rather than beautiful , jewels ; nothing of great value , nothing [she]67-sylvia could wear when in mourning . And then , four months after [[her]67-sylvia husband]254-her husband 's death , [[Sylvia]67-sylvia 's own aunt]255-sylvia 's own aunt had died and left [her]67-sylvia a thousand pounds . It was this legacy — which [[her]67-sylvia trustee]256-her trustee , [a young solicitor named [William Chester]78-chester , who was also [a friend]258-a friend and an admirer of [hers]67-sylvia , as well as [[her]67-sylvia trustee]256-her trustee]257-a young solicitor named william chester , who was also a friend and an admirer of hers , as well as her trustee , had been proposing to invest in what [he]78-chester called " a remarkably good thing"—Mrs[78-chester] . [Bailey]71-mrs. bailey had insisted on squandering on a string of pearls ! [Sylvia]67-sylvia had become aware , in the subtle way in which [Women]260-women become aware of such things , that pearls were the fashion — in fact , in one sense , " the only wear . "[67-sylvia] [She]67-sylvia had noticed that [most of the great ladies of [the neighbourhood of [Market Dalling]10-market dalling]262-the neighbourhood of market dalling]261-most of the great ladies of the neighbourhood of market dalling , [those whom [she]67-sylvia saw on those occasions when [town and county]264-town and county meet]263-those whom she saw on those occasions when town and county meet , each wore a string of pearls . [She]67-sylvia had also come to know that pearls seem to be the only gems which can be worn with absolute propriety by [a widow]242-a widow , and so , suddenly , [she]67-sylvia had made up [her]67-sylvia mind to invest — [she]67-sylvia called it an " investment , "[67-sylvia] while [Chester]78-chester called it an " absurd extravagance"—in[67-sylvia] a string of pearls . [Bill Chester]79-chester had done [his]79-chester very best to persuade [her]67-sylvia to give up [her]67-sylvia silly notion , but [she]67-sylvia had held good ; [she]67-sylvia had shown [herself]67-sylvia , at any rate on this one occasion , and in spite of [her]67-sylvia kindly , yielding nature , obstinate . This was why [her]67-sylvia beautiful pearls had become to [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia a symbol of [her]67-sylvia freedom . The thousand pounds , invested as [Bill Chester]79-chester had meant to invest it , would have brought [her]67-sylvia in £ 55 a year , so [he]79-chester had told [her]67-sylvia in a grave , disapproving tone . In return [she]67-sylvia had told [him]79-chester , the colour rushing into [her]67-sylvia pretty face , that after all [she]67-sylvia had the right to do what [she]67-sylvia chose with [her]67-sylvia legacy , the more so that this thousand pounds was in a peculiar sense [her]67-sylvia own money , as [the woman who had left it [her]67-sylvia]266-the woman who had left it her was [[[her]67-sylvia mother]267-her mother 's sister , having nothing to do either with [[her]67-sylvia father]269-her father or with [the late George Bailey]77-george bailey]268-her mother 's sister , having nothing to do either with her father or with the late george bailey ! And so [she]67-sylvia had had [her]67-sylvia way — nay , more ; [Chester]79-chester , at the very last , had gone to great trouble in order that [she]67-sylvia might not be cheated over [her]67-sylvia purchase . Best of all , [Bill]79-chester — [Sylvia]67-sylvia always called [the serious - minded young lawyer]270-the serious - minded young lawyer " [Bill"—had]80-bill"—had[67-sylvia] lived to admit that [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey had made a good investment after all , for [her]71-mrs. bailey pearls had increased in value in the two years [she]71-mrs. bailey had had them . Be that as it may , [the young widow]271-the young widow often reminded [herself]271-the young widow that nothing [she]271-the young widow had ever bought , and nothing that had ever been given [her]271-the young widow , had caused [her]271-the young widow such lasting pleasure as [her]271-the young widow beloved string of pearls ! But on this pleasant June afternoon , in deference to [[her]67-sylvia determined friend]272-her determined friend 's advice , [she]67-sylvia took off [her]67-sylvia pearls before starting out for [Montmartre]3-montmartre , leaving the case in the charge of [M. With easy , leisurely steps , constantly stopping to look into the windows of [the quaint shops]275-the quaint shops [they]276-they passed on the way , [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia and [Anna Wolsky]72-anna walked up the steep , the almost mountainous byways and [narrow streets]277-narrow streets which lead to [the top of [Montmartre]3-montmartre]278-the top of montmartre . [The whole population]279-the whole population seemed to have poured itself out in the open air on this sunny day ; even [the shopkeepers]280-the shopkeepers had brought chairs out of [[their]280-the shopkeepers shops]281-their shops and sat on the pavement , gaily laughing and gossiping together in the eager way [Parisians]2516-parisians have . As [the two foreign ladies]283-the two foreign ladies , both young , both in [their]283-the two foreign ladies very different fashion good - looking , walked past [the sitting groups of [neighbours]285-neighbours]284-the sitting groups of neighbours — [men]286-men , [women]260-women , and [children]288-children would stop talking and stare intently at [them]284-the sitting groups of neighbours , as is also a Parisian way . At first [Sylvia]67-sylvia had disliked the manner in which [she]67-sylvia was stared at in [Paris]1-paris , and [she]67-sylvia had been much embarrassed as well as a little amused by the very frank remarks called forth in omnibuses as well as in [the street]289-the street by the brilliancy of [her]67-sylvia complexion and the bright beauty of [her]67-sylvia fair hair . But now [she]67-sylvia was almost used to this odd form of homage , which came quite as often from [women]260-women as from [men]286-men . " [The Rue Jolie]7-the rue jolie ? "[292-a cheerful - looking man] answered [a cheerful - looking man]292-a cheerful - looking man in answer to a question . " Why , it 's ever so much further up ! And it was much further up , close to [the very top of [the great hill]294-the great hill]293-the very top of the great hill ! " [She]311-the woman must have gone out , "[67-sylvia] said [Sylvia]67-sylvia , rather disappointed . " Qui est là ? "[67-sylvia] And this time it was [Anna Wolsky]72-anna who , leaning forward , nodded gravely . "[392-the other hastily] On the morning after [her]390-her visit to [Madame Cagliostra]68-madame cagliostra , [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia woke later than usual . [She]390-her had had a disturbed night , and it was pleasant to feel that [she]390-her could spend a long restful day doing nothing , or only taking part in one of the gay little expeditions which make [Paris]1-paris to a stranger [the most delightful of [European capitals]394-european capitals]393-the most delightful of european capitals . [She]390-her opened wide both the windows of [[her]390-her room]395-her room , and from outside there floated in a busy , happy murmur , for [Paris]1-paris is [an early city]396-an early city , and nine o'clock there is equivalent to eleven o'clock in [London]4-london . [She]390-her heard the picturesque street cries of [the flower - sellers in [the Avenue de l'Opéra—"Beflower]2626-the avenue de l'opéra—"beflower [yourselves]2627-yourselves , [gentlemen]2628-gentlemen and [ladies]2522-ladies]2625-the flower - sellers in the avenue de l'opéra—"beflower yourselves , gentlemen and ladies , beflower [yourselves]2627-yourselves ! "[390-her] The gay , shrill sounds floated in to [her]390-her , and , in spite of [her]390-her bad night and ugly dreams , [she]390-her felt extraordinarily well and happy . [Cities]397-cities are like [people]398-people . In [some cities]399-some cities one feels at [home]400-home at once ; [others]401-others remain , however well acquainted [we]402-we become with [them]401-others , always [strangers]403-strangers . [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia , born , bred , married , widowed in [an English provincial town]404-an english provincial town , had always felt strange in [London]4-london . But with [[Paris,—dear]15-paris,—dear , delightful , sunny [Paris,—she]16-paris,—she]405-paris,—dear , delightful , sunny paris,—she had become on the closest , the most affectionately intimate terms from the first day . [She]67-sylvia had only been [here]2519-here a month , and yet [she]67-sylvia already knew with familiar knowledge [the quarter in which was situated [[her]67-sylvia quiet little hotel]408-her quiet little hotel]407-the quarter in which was situated her quiet little hotel , [that wonderful square mile — [it]410-it is not more — which has as [its]409-that wonderful square mile — it is not more — which has as its centre the paris opera house centre the [Paris]1-paris Opera House]409-that wonderful square mile — it is not more — which has as its centre the paris opera house , and which includes [the Rue de la Paix]17-the rue de la paix and the beginning of each of [the great arteries of modern [Paris]1-paris]411-the great arteries of modern paris . And that was not all . [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia knew something of the [France]18-france of the past . [The quiet , clever , old - fashioned Frenchwoman by whom [she]67-sylvia had been educated]412-the quiet , clever , old - fashioned frenchwoman by whom she had been educated had seen to that . [She]67-sylvia was now half sorry to think that in ten days or so [she]67-sylvia had promised to join [some acquaintances in [Switzerland]14-switzerland]415-some acquaintances in switzerland . Luckily [[her]67-sylvia trustee and would - be lover]416-her trustee and would - be lover , [Bill Chester]79-chester , proposed to come out and join the party [there]210-there . That was something to look forward to , for [Sylvia]67-sylvia was very fond of [him]79-chester , though [he]79-chester sometimes made [her]67-sylvia angry by [his]79-chester fussy ways . [She]67-sylvia told [herself]67-sylvia that there was no hope of finding [Anna]72-anna in such a large place , and that it was unlikely that [this dreary - looking town]517-this dreary - looking town would offer anything in the least pleasant or amusing on a very hot day . But " It will be enchanting by [the lake]2707-the lake ! "[518-some one] [she]67-sylvia heard [some one]518-some one say eagerly . And this chance remark made up [her]67-sylvia mind for [her]67-sylvia . After all , [she]67-sylvia might as well go and see [the lake]2707-the lake , of which [everyone who mentioned [Lacville]20-lacville]520-everyone who mentioned lacville spoke so enthusiastically . Down [the whole party]521-the whole party swept along [a narrow street]522-a narrow street , bordered by [high white houses]523-high white houses , [shabby cafés]524-shabby cafés , and [little shops]525-little shops . [Quite a crowd]526-quite a crowd had left [the station]475-the station , and [they]526-quite a crowd were all now going the same way . A turn in [the narrow street]528-the narrow street , and [Sylvia]67-sylvia uttered a low cry of pleasure and astonishment ! Before [her]67-sylvia , like a scene in a play when the curtain is rung up , there suddenly appeared an immense sunlit expanse of water , fringed by high trees , and bordered by [quaint , pretty châlets]529-quaint , pretty châlets and [villas]530-villas , fantastic in shape , and each surrounded by [a garden]531-a garden , which in many cases ran down to [the edge of [the lake]2707-the lake]532-the edge of the lake . " Is it not lovely ? "[535-the frenchman] said [the Frenchman]535-the frenchman eagerly . " And [the water of [the lake]2707-the lake]2710-the water of the lake is so shallow , [Madame]2550-madame , there is no fear of [anyone]2713-anyone being drowned in [it]2707-the lake ! That is such an advantage when [one]2530-one has [children]288-children . "[535-the frenchman] " And it is a hundred times more charming in the afternoon , "[455-his wife] [[his]535-the frenchman wife]455-his wife chimed in , happily , " for then [the lake]2707-the lake is so full of [little sailing - boats]2717-little sailing - boats that [you]2718-you can hardly see the water . [The Salle des Jeux]668-the salle des jeux at [Lacville]20-lacville is [a charming , conservatory - like apartment]669-a charming , conservatory - like apartment , looking , indeed , as if [it]668-the salle des jeux were actually built out on [the water]670-the water . But [none of [the people]672-the people]671-none of the people were looking at the beautiful scene outside . Instead , [each group]673-each group was intent on the table , and on the game being played thereon — a game , it may be mentioned , which has a certain affinity with Roulette and [Petits Chevaux]28-petits chevaux , though it is neither the one nor the other . [Sylvia]67-sylvia looked about [her]67-sylvia timidly ; but [no one]674-no one took the slightest notice of [her]67-sylvia , and this in itself was rather strange . [She]67-sylvia was used to exciting a good deal of attention wherever [she]67-sylvia went in [France]18-france , but here , at [Lacville]20-lacville , [everyone]547-everyone seemed blind to [her]67-sylvia presence . It was almost as if [she]67-sylvia were invisible ! In a way this was a relief to [her]67-sylvia ; but at the same time , [she]67-sylvia found it curiously disconcerting . [She]67-sylvia walked slowly round each gambling table , keeping well outside the various circles of [people sitting and standing there]676-people sitting and standing there . Strange to say [Anna Wolsky]72-anna was not among [them]672-the people . Of that fact [Sylvia]67-sylvia soon became quite sure . Five minutes later play was in full swing . [Sylvia]67-sylvia did not in the least understand the game of Baccarat , and [she]67-sylvia would have been surprised indeed had [she]67-sylvia been told that the best account of it ever written is that which describes it as " neither a recreation nor an intellectual exercise , but simply a means for the rapid exchange of money well suited to [persons of impatient temperament]2799-persons of impatient temperament . "[67-sylvia] With fascinated eyes , [Sylvia]67-sylvia watched [Anna]72-anna put down [her]72-anna gold pieces on the green cloth . Then [she]67-sylvia noted the cards as they were dealt out , and listened , it must be admitted , uncomprehendingly , to the mysterious words which told how the game was going . Still [she]67-sylvia sympathised very heartily with [[her]67-sylvia friend]202-her friend when [Anna]72-anna 's gold pieces were swept away , and [she]67-sylvia rejoiced as heartily when gold was added to [Anna]72-anna 's little pile . [They]706-they both stood , refusing the seats which were pressed upon [them]706-they . Suddenly [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia , looking up from the green cloth , saw the eyes of [the man who held the Bank fixed full upon [her]67-sylvia]707-the man who held the bank fixed full upon her . [The Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu did not gaze at [the young English woman]708-the young english woman with the bold , impersonal stare to which [she]67-sylvia had become accustomed — [his]99-the comte de virieu glance was far more thoughtful , questioning , and in a sense kindly . But [his]99-the comte de virieu eyes seemed to pierce [her]67-sylvia through and through , and suddenly [her]67-sylvia heart began to beat very fast . Yet no colour came into [her]67-sylvia face — indeed , [Sylvia]67-sylvia grew pale . [She]67-sylvia looked down at the table , but even so [she]67-sylvia remained conscious of that piercing gaze turned on [her]67-sylvia , and with some surprise [she]67-sylvia found [herself]67-sylvia keenly visualising [the young man]598-the young man 's face . Alone among all [the people in the room]710-the people in the room , [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu looked as if [he]99-the comte de virieu lived a more or less outdoor life ; [his]99-the comte de virieu face was tanned , [his]99-the comte de virieu blue eyes were very bright , and the hands dealing out the cards were well - shaped and muscular . Somehow [he]99-the comte de virieu looked very different , [she]67-sylvia could hardly explain how or why , from [the men round [him]99-the comte de virieu]711-the men round him . At last [she]67-sylvia moved round , so as to avoid being opposite to [him]99-the comte de virieu . Yes , [she]67-sylvia felt more comfortable now , and slowly , almost insensibly , the glamour of play began to steal over [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia 's senses . [She]67-sylvia began to understand the at once very simple and , to the uninitiated , intricate game of Baccarat — to long , as [Anna Wolsky]72-anna longed , for the fateful nine , eight , five , and four to be turned up . [She]67-sylvia had fifty francs in [her]67-sylvia purse , and [she]67-sylvia ached to risk a gold piece . " Do [you]72-anna think [I]67-sylvia might put down ten francs ? " Well , "[72-anna] said [Anna]72-anna at last , " [I]72-anna suppose [we]2849-we had better leave now , but [we]2849-we might as well go on driving for about an hour , and then , when it is a little cooler , [we]2849-we will go back to [Paris]1-paris and be [there]210-there in time for tea . "[72-anna] [The driver]726-the driver was as good - natured as [everyone else at [Lacville]20-lacville]784-everyone else at lacville seemed to be . " Even five years ago , "[726-the driver] [he]726-the driver said , " much of this was forest , [Mesdames]87-mesdames ; but now — well , [Dame!—you]104-dame!—you can understand [people]398-people are eager to sell . There are rumours that [the Concession]2852-the concession may be withdrawn from [the Casino]2652-the casino — that would be terrible , some say it would kill [Lacville]20-lacville ! It would be all the same to [me]185-the man , [I]185-the man should always find work elsewhere . But it makes [everyone]547-everyone eager to sell — those , [I]185-the man mean , who have land at [Lacville]20-lacville . "[726-the driver] When [the two friends]217-the two friends finally got back to [the Hôtel de l'Horloge]207-the hôtel de l'horloge , [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia found that a letter , which had not been given to [her]67-sylvia that morning , contained the news that [the English friends whom [she]67-sylvia had been expecting to join in [Switzerland]14-switzerland]792-the english friends whom she had been expecting to join in switzerland the following week had altered [their]792-the english friends whom she had been expecting to join in switzerland plans , and were no longer going abroad . [Sylvia]67-sylvia could hardly have said how it came about that [she]67-sylvia found [herself]67-sylvia established in [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac only a week after [her]67-sylvia first visit to [Lacville]20-lacville ! But so it was , and [she]67-sylvia found the change a delightful one from every point of view . [Paris]1-paris had suddenly become intolerably hot . As is the way with [the Siren city]794-the siren city when June is half - way through , [the asphalt pavements]795-the asphalt pavements radiated heat ; the air was heavy , laden with strange , unpleasing odours ; and even the trees , which form such delicious oases of greenery in [the older quarters of [the town]785-the town]796-the older quarters of the town were powdered with grey dust . Also [Anna Wolsky]72-anna had become restless — quite unlike what [she]72-anna had been before that hour spent by [her]72-anna and by [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia in [the Club at [Lacville]20-lacville]798-the club at lacville ; [she]72-anna had gone back [there]210-there three times , refusing , almost angrily , the company of [[her]72-anna English friend]800-her english friend . For a day or two [Sylvia]67-sylvia had thought seriously of returning to [England]8-england , but [she]67-sylvia had let [[her]67-sylvia pretty house at [Market Dalling]10-market dalling]801-her pretty house at market dalling till the end of August ; and , in spite of the heat , [she]67-sylvia did not wish to leave [France]18-france . Towards the end of the week [Anna]72-anna suddenly exclaimed : " After all , why should n't [you]67-sylvia come out to [Lacville]20-lacville , [Sylvia]67-sylvia ? [The Casino]2652-the casino was outlined with fairy lamps ; the scene was full of glamour , and of mysterious beauty . All was so strange , new , and delightful , and [she]67-sylvia fell asleep and dreamt pleasant dreams . [She]67-sylvia looked round [the large , airy room]959-the large , airy room , which was so absolutely unlike [the small bed - room [she]67-sylvia had occupied in [the Hôtel de l'Horloge]207-the hôtel de l'horloge]960-the small bed - room she had occupied in the hôtel de l'horloge , with a sense of bewilderment and surprise . Why of course [she]67-sylvia was at [Lacville]20-lacville ; and [this delightful , luxurious room]962-this delightful , luxurious room had been furnished and arranged for [[the lady]490-the lady - in - waiting and friend of [the Empress Eugénie]98-the empress eugénie]964-the lady - in - waiting and friend of the empress eugénie . The fact gave an added touch of romance to [the Hôtel du Lac]594-the hôtel du lac . A ray of bright sunlight streamed in through the curtains [she]67-sylvia had pinned together the night before . And [her]67-sylvia travelling clock told [her]67-sylvia that it was not yet six . But [Sylvia]67-sylvia jumped out of bed , and , drawing back the curtains , [she]67-sylvia looked out , and across [the lake]2707-the lake . [The now solitary expanse of water]967-the now solitary expanse of water seemed to possess a new beauty in the early morning sunlight , and the white Casino , of which the minarets were reflected in its blue depths , might have been [a dream palace]968-a dream palace . Nothing broke the intense stillness but the loud , sweet twittering of the birds in the trees which surrounded [the lake]2707-the lake . But soon the spell was broken . When the six strokes of the hour chimed out from [the old parish church which forms [the centre of [the town of Lacville]972-the town of lacville]971-the centre of the town of lacville]970-the old parish church which forms the centre of the town of lacville , as if by enchantment there rose sounds of stir both indoors and out . [A woman]309-a woman came out of [the lodge of [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac]974-the lodge of the villa du lac , and slowly opened the great steel and gilt gates . [Sylvia]67-sylvia heard the rush of bath water , even the queer click - click of a shower bath . [M. Polperro]93-m. polperro evidently insisted on an exceptional standard of cleanliness for [[his]93-m. polperro household]976-his household . [Sylvia]67-sylvia felt fresh and well . The languor induced by the heat of [Paris]1-paris had left [her]67-sylvia . There seemed no reason why [she]67-sylvia should not get up too , and even go out of doors if so the fancy pleased [her]67-sylvia . [She]67-sylvia had just finished dressing when there came curious sounds from the front of [the Villa]583-the villa , and again [she]67-sylvia went over to [her]67-sylvia window . A horse was being walked up and down on the stones of [the courtyard]306-the courtyard in front of the horseshoe stairway which led up to [the hall]635-the hall door . It was not yet half - past six . Who could be going to ride at this early hour of the morning ? Soon [her]67-sylvia unspoken question was answered ; for [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu , clad in riding breeches and a black jersey , came out of [the house]579-the house , and close on [his]99-the comte de virieu heels trotted [M. [The owner of [the Hôtel du Lac]594-the hôtel du lac]982-the owner of the hôtel du lac was very proud of [[his]982-the owner of the hôtel du lac noble guest]984-his noble guest . [Sylvia]67-sylvia told [herself]67-sylvia that [he]99-the comte de virieu looked very well in [his]99-the comte de virieu rather odd riding dress . [Sylvia]67-sylvia wondered if [he]99-the comte de virieu were going for a ride in [the Forest of [Montmorency]21-montmorency]42-the forest of montmorency , which , in [her]67-sylvia lying guide - book , was mentioned as [the principal attraction of [Lacville]20-lacville]986-the principal attraction of lacville . "[67-sylvia] [She]67-sylvia unpacked [her]67-sylvia trunks , and as [she]67-sylvia put [her]67-sylvia things away it suddenly struck [her]67-sylvia that [she]67-sylvia meant to stay at [Lacville]20-lacville for some time . [Comte Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu 's heart began to beat . But , bah ! This was absurd ! [His]99-the comte de virieu day of love and love - making lay far , far behind [him]99-the comte de virieu . [He]99-the comte de virieu rose and walked towards the door . [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's gentle and unsophisticated charm had touched [him]99-the comte de virieu deeply , and so [he]99-the comte de virieu had given [her]67-sylvia what [he]99-the comte de virieu knew to be the best possible advice . " [I]99-the comte de virieu am not so foolish as to pretend that [the people who come and play in [the Casino of [Lacville]20-lacville]661-the casino of lacville]3055-the people who come and play in the casino of lacville are [all confirmed gamblers]3057-all confirmed gamblers , "[99-the comte de virieu] [he]99-the comte de virieu said , slowly . "[619-the count] [Sylvia]67-sylvia had never heard such bitter accents issue from human lips before . "[619-the count] [Sylvia]67-sylvia went [upstairs]246-upstairs to [[her]67-sylvia room]395-her room . [She]67-sylvia was touched , moved , excited . It was quite a new experience with [her]67-sylvia to come so really near to [any man]1066-any man 's heart and conscience . Life is a secret and a tangled skein , full of loose , almost invisible threads . This curiously intimate , and yet impersonal conversation with one who was not only [a stranger]2555-a stranger , but also [a foreigner]2551-a foreigner , made [her]67-sylvia realise how little [[we]1069-we men]1070-we men and [women]260-women really know of [one another]191-one another . How small was [her]67-sylvia knowledge , for instance , of [Bill Chester]79-chester — though , to be sure , of [him]79-chester there was perhaps nothing to know . How really little also [she]67-sylvia knew of [Anna Wolsky]72-anna ! [They]1073-they had become [friends]2741-friends , and yet [Anna]72-anna had never confided to [her]67-sylvia any intimate or secret thing about [herself]72-anna . Why , [she]67-sylvia did not even know [[Anna]72-anna 's home address]1075-anna 's home address ! [Sylvia]67-sylvia felt that there was now a link which hardly anything could break between [herself]67-sylvia and [this Frenchman]1076-this frenchman , whom [she]67-sylvia had never seen till a week ago . [He]79-chester had lifted a corner of the veil which covered [his]79-chester conscience , and [he]79-chester had done this in order that [he]79-chester might save [her]67-sylvia , [a stranger]2555-a stranger , from what [he]79-chester knew by personal experience to be a terrible fate ! "[73-madame wolsky] When [the two friends]217-the two friends came [downstairs]203-downstairs again , [they]217-the two friends found [Monsieur]1125-monsieur and [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia standing close together and speaking in a low voice . [The dining - room]577-the dining - room was more than plainly furnished ; [it]577-the dining - room was positively ugly . "[2555-a stranger] [Sylvia]67-sylvia , feeling rather bewildered , slipped into [[her]67-sylvia friend]202-her friend 's place , and [Anna]72-anna kept close behind [her]67-sylvia . "[99-the comte de virieu] And then [Sylvia]67-sylvia saw [her]67-sylvia stake and that of [the Count]619-the count doubled . There were now four gold pieces where two had been . " [The poor man]3237-the poor man had not one penny piece till [she]67-sylvia came in , and [he]3237-the poor man got so angry and impatient waiting for [her]67-sylvia ! " [You]67-sylvia think it is a case of ' the pot calling the kettle black . ' How excellent are [your]67-sylvia English proverbs , [dear Sylvia]67-sylvia ! But no , it is quite different . Take [me]72-anna . [I]72-anna have an income , and choose to spend it in gambling . [I]72-anna might prefer to have [a big house]3249-a big house , or perhaps [I]72-anna should say [a small house]3250-a small house , for [I]72-anna am not [a very rich woman]3251-a very rich woman . [He]99-the comte de virieu is , so [I]72-anna 've been told , [a clever , cultivated man]3252-a clever , cultivated man . "[72-anna] " [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia told [me]67-sylvia to - day all about [[their]3257-they poor friend who was drowned]3258-their poor friend who was drowned , "[67-sylvia] said [Sylvia]67-sylvia irrelevantly . " Ah , yes , that was a sad affair ! [They]3257-they were very foolish to become so intimate with [him]3258-their poor friend who was drowned . "[72-anna] " It must have been terrible for [Monsieur]3276-monsieur and [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , "[67-sylvia] said [Sylvia]67-sylvia thoughtfully . " Oh yes , very disagreeable indeed ! It is rather mournful when [one]2530-one knows [no one]674-no one at all in a place of this kind . "[67-sylvia] And [Anna]72-anna agreed , indifferently . And then there began a series of long cloudless days for [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia . For the first time [she]67-sylvia felt as if [she]67-sylvia was seeing life , and such seeing was very pleasant to [her]67-sylvia . Not in [her]67-sylvia wildest dreams , during the placid days of [her]67-sylvia girlhood and brief married life , had [she]67-sylvia conceived of so interesting and so exhilarating an existence as that which [she]67-sylvia was now leading ! And this was perhaps owing in a measure to the fact that there is , if one may so express it , a spice of naughtiness in life as led at [Lacville]20-lacville . In a mild , a very mild , way [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia had fallen a victim to [the Goddess of Play]3021-the goddess of play . [She]67-sylvia soon learned to look forward to the hours [she]67-sylvia and [Anna Wolsky]72-anna spent each day at the baccarat tables . But , unlike [Anna]72-anna , [Sylvia]67-sylvia was never tempted to risk a greater sum on that dangerous green cloth than [she]67-sylvia could comfortably afford to lose , and perhaps just because this was so , on the whole [she]67-sylvia won money rather than lost it . A certain change had come over the relations of [the two women]335-the two women . [They]335-the two women still met daily , if only at [the Casino]2652-the casino , and [they]335-the two women occasionally took a walk or a drive together , but [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky — and [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia felt uneasy and growing concern that it was so — now lived for play , and play alone . Absorbed in the simple yet fateful turns of the game , [Anna]72-anna would remain silent for hours , immersed in calculations , and scarcely aware of what went on round [her]72-anna . [She]72-anna and [Monsieur Wachner—"L'Ami Fritz]121-monsieur wachner—"l'ami fritz , "[121-monsieur wachner—"l'ami fritz] as even [Sylvia]67-sylvia had fallen into the way of calling [him]1290-him — seemed scarcely alive unless [they]335-the two women were standing or sitting round a baccarat table , putting down or taking up the shining gold pieces which [they]335-the two women treated as carelessly as if they were counters . But it was not the easy , idle , purposeless life [she]72-anna was now leading that brought the pretty English widow that strange , unacknowledged feeling of entire content with life . What made existence at [Lacville]20-lacville so exciting and so exceptionally interesting to [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia was [her]67-sylvia friendship with [Comte Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu . There is in [every woman]219-every woman a passion for romance , and in [Sylvia]67-sylvia this passion had been baulked , not satisfied , by [her]67-sylvia first marriage . [Bill Chester]79-chester loved [her]67-sylvia well and deeply , but [he]79-chester was [[her]67-sylvia lawyer]1292-her lawyer and [trustee]1293-trustee as well as [[her]67-sylvia lover]1294-her lover . [He]79-chester had an honest , straightforward nature , and when with [her]67-sylvia something always prompted [Chester]79-chester to act the part of [candid friend]1295-candid friend , and the part of [candid friend]1295-candid friend fits in very ill with that of [lover]1297-lover . To take but one example of how ill [his]79-chester honesty of purpose served [him]79-chester in the matter , [Sylvia]67-sylvia had never really forgiven [him]79-chester the " fuss "[79-chester] [he]79-chester had made about [her]67-sylvia string of pearls . But with [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu [she]67-sylvia never quite knew what to be at , and mystery is the food of romance . At [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac [the two]190-the two were almost inseparable , and yet so intelligently and quietly did [the Count]619-the count arrange [their]190-the two frequent meetings — [their]190-the two long walks and talks in [the large deserted garden]1301-the large deserted garden , [their]190-the two pleasant morning saunters through [the little town]1302-the little town — that [no one]674-no one , or so [Sylvia]67-sylvia believed , was aware of any special intimacy between [them]190-the two . Sometimes , as [they]190-the two paced up and down [the flower - bordered paths of [the old kitchen - garden]1285-the old kitchen - garden]1304-the flower - bordered paths of the old kitchen - garden , or when , tired of walking , [they]190-the two made [their]190-the two way into [the orangery]3013-the orangery and sat down on the circular stone bench by the fountain , [Sylvia]67-sylvia would remember , deep in [her]67-sylvia heart , the first time [Count Paul]94-count paul had brought [her]67-sylvia [there]210-there ; and how [she]67-sylvia had been a little frightened , not perhaps altogether unpleasantly so , by [his]94-count paul proximity ! [She]67-sylvia had feared — but [she]67-sylvia was now deeply ashamed of having entertained such a thought — that [he]94-count paul might suddenly begin making violent love to [her]67-sylvia , that [he]94-count paul might perhaps try to kiss [her]67-sylvia ! Were not [all Frenchmen of [his]94-count paul type]1308-all frenchmen of his type rather gay dogs ? But nothing — nothing of the sort had ever been within measurable distance of happening . On the contrary , [he]94-count paul always treated [her]67-sylvia with scrupulous respect , and [he]94-count paul never — and this sometimes piqued [Sylvia]67-sylvia — made love to [her]67-sylvia , or attempted to flirt with [her]67-sylvia . Instead , [he]94-count paul talked to [her]67-sylvia in that intimate , that confiding fashion which [a woman]309-a woman finds so attractive in [a man]234-a man when [she]309-a woman has reason to believe [his]234-a man confidences are made to [her]309-a woman alone . When [Bill Chester]79-chester asked [her]67-sylvia not to do something [she]67-sylvia desired to do , [Sylvia]67-sylvia felt annoyed and impatient , but when [Count Paul]94-count paul , as [she]67-sylvia had fallen into the way of calling [him]94-count paul , made no secret of [his]94-count paul wish that [she]67-sylvia should give up play , [Sylvia]67-sylvia felt touched and pleased that [he]94-count paul should care . Early in [their]1311-their acquaintance [the Count]619-the count had warned [her]67-sylvia against making casual friendships in [the Gambling Rooms]1313-the gambling rooms , and [he]94-count paul even did not like [her]67-sylvia knowing — this amused [Sylvia]67-sylvia — [the harmless Wachners]114-the wachners . When [he]94-count paul saw [her]67-sylvia talking to [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia in [the Club]2766-the club , [Count Paul]94-count paul would look across the baccarat table and there would come a little frown over [his]94-count paul eyes — a frown [she]67-sylvia alone could see . And as the days went on , and as [their]1311-their intimacy seemed to grow closer and ever closer , there came across [Sylvia]67-sylvia a deep wordless wish — and [she]67-sylvia had never longed for anything so much in [her]67-sylvia life — to rescue [[her]67-sylvia friend]202-her friend from what [he]202-her friend admitted to be [his]202-her friend terrible vice of gambling . In this [she]67-sylvia showed rather a feminine lack of logic , for , while wishing to wean [him]202-her friend from [his]202-her friend vice , [she]67-sylvia did not [herself]67-sylvia give up going to [the Casino]2652-the casino . [She]67-sylvia would have been angry indeed had the truth been whispered to [her]67-sylvia , the truth that it was not so much [her]67-sylvia little daily gamble — as [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia called it — that made [[Sylvia]67-sylvia so faithful an attendant at [the Club]2766-the club]1317-sylvia so faithful an attendant at the club ; it was because when there [she]67-sylvia was still with [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul , [she]67-sylvia could see and sympathise with [him]94-count paul when [he]94-count paul was winning , and grieve when [he]94-count paul was losing , as alas ! [he]94-count paul often lost . When [they]1319-they were not at [the Casino]2652-the casino [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu very seldom alluded to [his]99-the comte de virieu play , or to the good or ill fortune which might have befallen [him]99-the comte de virieu that day . When with [her]67-sylvia [he]99-the comte de virieu tried , so much was clear to [Sylvia]67-sylvia , to forget [his]99-the comte de virieu passion for gambling . But this curious friendship of [hers]67-sylvia with [Count Paul]94-count paul only occupied , in a material sense , a small part of [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's daily life at [Lacville]20-lacville ; and [the people with whom [she]67-sylvia spent most of [her]67-sylvia time]1321-the people with whom she spent most of her time were still [Anna Wolsky]72-anna and [Monsieur]1322-monsieur and [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , or perhaps it should be said [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia . It was not wonderful that [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey liked [the cheerful woman , who was so bright and jovial in manner]1323-the cheerful woman , who was so bright and jovial in manner , and who knew , too , how to flatter so cleverly . When with [Madame Wachner Sylvia]67-sylvia was made to feel that [she]67-sylvia was not only very pretty , but also immensely attractive , and just now [she]67-sylvia was very anxious to think [herself]67-sylvia both . Late one afternoon — and [they]1324-they all four always met each afternoon at [the Casino]2652-the casino — [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia suddenly invited [Sylvia]67-sylvia and [Anna]72-anna to come back to supper at [the Châlet des Muguets]3173-the châlet des muguets . [Anna]72-anna was unwilling to accept the kindly invitation . It was clear that [she]67-sylvia did not wish to waste as much time away from [the Casino]2652-the casino as going to [[the Wachners]114-the wachners ' villa]1328-the wachners ' villa would involve . But , seeing that [Sylvia]67-sylvia was eager to go , [she]67-sylvia gave way . Now on this particular afternoon [Sylvia]67-sylvia was feeling rather dull , and , as [she]67-sylvia expressed it to [herself]67-sylvia , " down on [her]67-sylvia luck , "[67-sylvia] for [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu had gone into [Paris]1-paris for a few hours . [[His]99-the comte de virieu sister]3245-his sister , [the Duchesse d'Eglemont]1330-the duchesse d'eglemont , had come up from [the country]424-the country for a few days , and the great pleasure and delight [he]99-the comte de virieu had expressed at the thought of seeing [her]67-sylvia had given [the young English widow]1332-the young english widow a little pang of pain . It made [her]67-sylvia feel how little [she]67-sylvia counted in [his]99-the comte de virieu life after all . And so , for the second time , [Sylvia]67-sylvia visited the odd , fantastic - looking Châlet des Muguets , and under very pleasant auspices . This evening [the bare dining - room]1333-the bare dining - room [she]67-sylvia had thought so ugly wore an air of festivity . There were flowers on the round table and on the buffet , but , to [her]67-sylvia surprise , a piece of oilcloth now hid the parquet floor . This puzzled [Sylvia]67-sylvia , as such trifling little matters of fact often puzzle a fresh young mind . Surely the oilcloth had not been there on [her]67-sylvia last visit to [the villa]583-the villa ? [She]67-sylvia remembered clearly the unpolished parquet floor . Thanks to [the hostess]1335-the hostess and to [Sylvia]67-sylvia [herself]67-sylvia , supper was a bright , merry meal . There was a variety of cold meats , some fine fruit , and a plate of dainty pastry . [They]1336-they all waited on one another , though [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia insisted on doing most of the work . But [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz , for once looking cheerful and eager , mixed the salad , putting in even more vinegar than oil , as [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey laughingly confessed that [she]71-mrs. bailey hated olive oil ! After [they]1336-they had eaten [their]1336-they appetising little meal , [the host]868-the host went off into [the kitchen]3190-the kitchen where [Sylvia]67-sylvia had had tea on [her]67-sylvia first visit to [the Châlet]1339-the châlet , and there [he]868-the host made the most excellent coffee for [[them]1336-they all]1340-them all , and even [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey , who was treated as [the guest of honour]1341-the guest of honour , though [she]71-mrs. bailey knew that coffee was not good for [her]71-mrs. bailey , was tempted into taking some . One thing , however , rather dashed [her]67-sylvia pleasure in the entertainment . [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , forgetting for once [her]67-sylvia usual tact , suddenly made a violent attack on [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu . [They]1336-they were all talking of the habitués of [the Casino]2652-the casino : " The only one [I]67-sylvia do not like , "[67-sylvia] [she]67-sylvia exclaimed , in French , " is that Count — if indeed [Count]94-count paul [he]94-count paul be ? [He]94-count paul is so arrogant , so proud , so rude ! [We]1336-they have known [him]94-count paul for years , have [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz and [I]67-sylvia , for [we]1336-they are always running across [him]94-count paul at [Monte Carlo]9-monte carlo and other places . But no , each time [we]1336-they meet [he]94-count paul looks at [us]1336-they as if [he]94-count paul was a fish . [He]94-count paul does not even nod ! "[67-sylvia] " When [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu is actually playing , [he]94-count paul does not know that [other people]2532-other people exist , "[72-anna] said [Anna Wolsky]72-anna , slowly . [She]72-anna had looked across at [Sylvia]67-sylvia and noticed [[her]72-anna English friend]800-her english friend 's blush and look of embarrassment . " [I]72-anna used to watch [him]94-count paul two years ago at [Monte Carlo]9-monte carlo , and [I]72-anna have never seen [a man more absorbed in [his]94-count paul play]3283-a man more absorbed in his play . "[72-anna] " That is no excuse ! "[67-sylvia] cried [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , scornfully . " Besides , that is only half the truth . [He]94-count paul is ashamed of the way [he]94-count paul is spending [his]94-count paul life , and [he]94-count paul hates [the people who see [him]94-count paul doing it]3284-the people who see him doing it ! It is shameful to be so idle . [A strong young man]3285-a strong young man doing nothing , living on charity , so [they]3284-the people who see him doing it say ! And [he]94-count paul despises [all those who do what [he]94-count paul [himself]94-count paul]3286-all those who do what he himself is not ashamed to do . "[67-sylvia] And [Sylvia]67-sylvia , looking across at [her]67-sylvia , said to [herself]67-sylvia with a heavy sigh that this was true . [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia had summed up [Count Paul]94-count paul very accurately . At last there came the sound of [a carriage]1344-a carriage in [the quiet lane outside]1345-the quiet lane outside . " [Fritz]112-l'ami fritz ! The play , too , was much higher than usual . [[Our]1448-a little group of five young men in evening dress friend]3157-our friend has [the devil]3319-the devil 's own luck to - night ! [I]67-sylvia have forbidden [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz to play at all . Nothing can stand against [her]3157-our friend . [She]3157-our friend sweeps the money up every time . "[67-sylvia] But before doing so [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz lingered awhile , watching [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky 's wonderful run of luck with an expression of painful envy and greed on [his]112-l'ami fritz wolfish countenance . [Sylvia]67-sylvia went round to a point where [she]67-sylvia could watch [Anna]72-anna 's face . To [a stranger]2555-a stranger [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky might have appeared almost indifferent ; but there had come two spots of red on [her]73-madame wolsky cheeks , and the hand with which [she]73-madame wolsky raked up the money trembled . The words rang out , " Faites vos jeux , [Messieurs]3322-messieurs , Mesdames . "[72-anna] Then , " Le jeu est fait ! Rien ne va plus ! "[72-anna] The luck suddenly turned against [Anna]72-anna . [She]72-anna looked up , and found [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's eyes fixed on [her]72-anna . [She]72-anna made a slight motion , as if [she]72-anna wished [[her]72-anna friend]202-her friend to go away . [Sylvia]67-sylvia slipped back , and walked quietly round the table . Then [she]72-anna stood behind [Anna]72-anna , and once more the luck came back , and [the lady banker]1451-the lady banker 's pile of notes and gold grew higher and higher .... " This is the first time [a woman]309-a woman has held the Bank this month , "[933-someone] [Sylvia]67-sylvia heard [someone]933-someone say . Somehow to - night [she]67-sylvia did not feel inclined to play . To [her]67-sylvia surprise and amusement [she]67-sylvia saw [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia actually risk a twenty - franc piece . [She]67-sylvia felt that [she]67-sylvia ought to be very angry with [[her]67-sylvia friend]202-her friend for speaking thus plainly to [her]67-sylvia , and yet [she]67-sylvia could not be angry . [Anna]72-anna spoke so tenderly , so kindly , so delicately . " Shall [we]3388-we go away from [Lacville]20-lacville ? "[72-anna] asked [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky , suddenly . " There are a hundred places where [you]67-sylvia and [I]73-madame wolsky could go together . Let [us]3388-we leave [Lacville]20-lacville ! [I]73-madame wolsky am sure [you]67-sylvia feel just as [I]73-madame wolsky do — [I]73-madame wolsky am sure [you]67-sylvia realise that [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu would never make [you]67-sylvia happy . "[73-madame wolsky] [Sylvia]67-sylvia shook [her]67-sylvia head . " [I]67-sylvia do not want to go away , "[67-sylvia] [she]67-sylvia whispered . And then [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky uttered a short exclamation . " Ah ! "[73-madame wolsky] [she]73-madame wolsky cried , " [I]73-madame wolsky understand . [He]99-the comte de virieu is the friend [you]67-sylvia are to meet to - morrow — that is why [you]67-sylvia are going into [Paris]1-paris ! "[73-madame wolsky] [Sylvia]67-sylvia remained silent . " [I]72-anna understand it all now , "[72-anna] went on [Anna]72-anna . " That is the reason why [he]99-the comte de virieu was not there to - night . [He]99-the comte de virieu has gone into [Paris]1-paris so as not to compromise [you]67-sylvia at [Lacville]20-lacville . That is the sort of gallantry that means so little ! As if [Lacville]20-lacville matters — but tell [me]72-anna this , [Sylvia]67-sylvia ? Has [he]99-the comte de virieu ever spoken to [you]67-sylvia as if [he]99-the comte de virieu desired to introduce [[his]99-the comte de virieu family]2731-his family to [you]67-sylvia ? That is the test , remember — that is the test of [a Frenchman]227-a frenchman 's regard for [a woman]309-a woman . "[72-anna] There came a knock at the door . " [The carriage for [Madame]73-madame wolsky]3392-the carriage for madame has arrived . " [We]3399-we will meet the day after to - morrow , is that not so ? "[72-anna] [she]72-anna cried out . And [Sylvia]67-sylvia nodded . The next morning found [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu walking up and down [platform No . 9 of the Gare du Nord]1495-platform no . 9 of the gare du nord , waiting for [[Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey 's train]1496-mrs. bailey 's train , which was due to arrive from [Lacville]20-lacville at eleven o'clock . Though [he]99-the comte de virieu looked as if [he]99-the comte de virieu had n't a care in [the world]329-the world save the pleasant care of enjoying the present and looking forward to the future , life was very grey just now to [the young Frenchman]883-the young frenchman . To [a Parisian]1499-a parisian , [Paris]1-paris in hot weather is [a depressing place]1500-a depressing place , even under the pleasantest of circumstances , and [the Count]619-the count felt an alien and an outcast in [[the city]1502-the city where [he]619-the count had spent much of [his]619-the count careless and happy youth]1503-the city where he had spent much of his careless and happy youth . [[His]619-the count sister]3245-his sister , [the Duchesse d'Eglemont , who had journeyed all the way from [Brittany]56-brittany to see [him]99-the comte de virieu for two or three days]1505-the duchesse d'eglemont , who had journeyed all the way from brittany to see him for two or three days , had received [him]99-the comte de virieu with that touch of painful affection which [the kindly and the prosperous]1506-the kindly and the prosperous so often bestow on [those whom [they]1506-the kindly and the prosperous feel to be at once beloved and prodigal]1507-those whom they feel to be at once beloved and prodigal . When with [his]99-the comte de virieu dear [Marie - Anne]124-marie - anne , [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu always felt as though [he]99-the comte de virieu had been condemned to be guillotined , and as if [she]124-marie - anne were doing everything to make [his]99-the comte de virieu last days on [earth]1508-earth as pleasant as possible . When [he]99-the comte de virieu had proposed that [[his]99-the comte de virieu sister]3245-his sister should ask [[his]99-the comte de virieu new friend]1510-his new friend , [this English widow [he]99-the comte de virieu had met at [Lacville]20-lacville]1511-this english widow he had met at lacville , to luncheon — nay more , when [he]99-the comte de virieu had asked [Marie - Anne]124-marie - anne to lend [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey a riding habit , and to arrange that one of [the Duc]107-the duc 's horses should come over every morning in order that [he]99-the comte de virieu and [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey might ride together — [the kind Duchesse]1512-the kind duchesse had at once assented , almost too eagerly , to [his]99-the comte de virieu requests . And [she]124-marie - anne had asked [[her]124-marie - anne brother]1513-her brother no tiresome , indiscreet questions as to [his]99-the comte de virieu relations with [the young Englishwoman,—whether]1514-the young englishwoman,—whether , for instance , [he]99-the comte de virieu was really fond of [Sylvia]67-sylvia , whether it was conceivably possible that [he]99-the comte de virieu was thinking of marrying [her]67-sylvia ? And , truth to tell , [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu would have found it very difficult to give an honest answer to the question . [He]99-the comte de virieu was in a strange , debatable state of mind about [Sylvia]67-sylvia — beautiful , simple , unsophisticated [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia . [He]99-the comte de virieu told [himself]99-the comte de virieu , and that very often , that [the young Englishwoman]305-the young englishwoman , with [her]305-the young englishwoman absurd , touching lack of worldly knowledge , had no business to be living in such a place as [Lacville]20-lacville , wasting [her]305-the young englishwoman money at the Baccarat tables , and knowing such [queer people as were]1516-queer people as were — well , yes , even [Anna Wolsky]72-anna was queer — [Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky and [the Wachners]114-the wachners ! But if [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia had no business to be at [Lacville]20-lacville , [he]99-the comte de virieu , [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu , had no business to be flirting with [her]67-sylvia as [he]99-the comte de virieu was doing — for though [Sylvia]67-sylvia was honestly unaware of the fact , [the Count]619-the count was carrying on what [he]99-the comte de virieu well knew to be a very agreeable flirtation with the lady [he]99-the comte de virieu called in [his]99-the comte de virieu own mind [his]99-the comte de virieu " petite amie Anglaise , "[99-the comte de virieu] and very much [he]99-the comte de virieu was enjoying the experience — when [his]99-the comte de virieu conscience allowed [him]99-the comte de virieu to enjoy it . Till the last few weeks [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu had supposed [himself]99-the comte de virieu to have come to that time of life when [a man]234-a man can no longer feel the delicious tremors of love . Now [no man , least of all a Frenchman]1519-no man , least of all a frenchman , likes to feel that this time has come , and it was inexpressibly delightful to [him]99-the comte de virieu to know that [he]99-the comte de virieu had been mistaken — that [he]99-the comte de virieu could still enjoy the most absorbing and enchanting sensation vouchsafed to [poor humanity]1520-poor humanity . [He]99-the comte de virieu was in love ! In love for the first time for many years , and with [a sweet , happy - natured woman]1521-a sweet , happy - natured woman , who became more intimately dear to [him]99-the comte de virieu every moment that went by . Indeed , [he]99-the comte de virieu knew that the real reason why [he]99-the comte de virieu had felt so depressed last night and even this morning was because [he]99-the comte de virieu was parted from [Sylvia]67-sylvia . But where was it all to end ? True , [he]99-the comte de virieu had told [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey the truth about [himself]99-the comte de virieu very early in [their]1522-their acquaintance — in fact , amazingly soon , and [he]99-the comte de virieu had been prompted to do so by a feeling which defied analysis . But still , did [Sylvia]67-sylvia , even now , realise what that truth was ? Did [she]67-sylvia in the least understand what it meant for [a man]234-a man to be bound and gagged , as [he]234-a man was bound and gagged , lashed to the chariot of [the Goddess of Chance]1524-the goddess of chance ? No , of course [she]67-sylvia did not realise it — how could such [a woman]309-a woman as was [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia possibly do so ? Walking up and down [the long platform]1526-the long platform , chewing the cud of bitter reflection , [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu told [himself]99-the comte de virieu that the part of [an honest man]1527-an honest man , to say nothing of that of [an honourable gentleman]1528-an honourable gentleman , would be to leave [Lacville]20-lacville before matters had gone any further between [them]1522-their . Yes , that was what [he]99-the comte de virieu was bound to do by every code of honour . And then , just as [he]99-the comte de virieu had taken the heroic resolution of going back to [Brittany]56-brittany with [[his]99-the comte de virieu sister]3245-his sister , as [Marie - Anne]124-marie - anne had begged [him]99-the comte de virieu to do only that morning , [the Lacville train]480-the lacville train steamed into [the station]475-the station — and with the sight of [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's lovely face all [his]99-the comte de virieu good resolutions flew to the winds . [She]67-sylvia stepped down from [the high railway carriage]1532-the high railway carriage , and looked round [her]67-sylvia with a rather bewildered air , for [a crowd of people]667-a crowd of people were surging round [her]67-sylvia , and [she]67-sylvia had not yet caught sight of [Count Paul]94-count paul . Wearing a pinkish mauve cotton gown and a large black tulle hat , [Sylvia]67-sylvia looked enchantingly pretty . And if [the Count]619-the count 's critical French eyes objected to the alliance of a cotton gown and tulle hat , and to the wearing of a string of large pearls in the morning , [he]99-the comte de virieu was in the state of mind when [a man of fastidious taste]1535-a man of fastidious taste forgives even a lack of taste in [the woman to whom [he]99-the comte de virieu is acting as [guide , philosopher , and friend]1537-guide , philosopher , and friend]1536-the woman to whom he is acting as guide , philosopher , and friend . Suddenly [their]1540-their eyes met . [Sylvia]67-sylvia blushed — Heavens ! how adorable [she]67-sylvia looked when there came that vivid rose - red blush over [her]67-sylvia rounded cheeks . And [she]67-sylvia was adorable in a simple , unsophisticated way , which appealed to [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul as nothing in [woman]485-woman had ever appealed to [him]99-the comte de virieu before . [He]99-the comte de virieu could not help enjoying the thought of how surprised [[his]99-the comte de virieu sister]3245-his sister would be . " [Every Frenchman]220-every frenchman , "[99-the comte de virieu] [he]99-the comte de virieu exclaimed , abruptly , " is in love with love , and when [you]67-sylvia hear — as [you]67-sylvia may do sometimes , [Madame]67-sylvia — that [a Frenchman]227-a frenchman is rarely in love with [[his]227-a frenchman own wife]3404-his own wife , pray answer that this is quite untrue ! "[99-the comte de virieu] [He]99-the comte de virieu looked straight before [him]99-the comte de virieu as [he]99-the comte de virieu added : " As for marriage — well , marriage is in [[my]99-the comte de virieu country]3407-my country regarded as a very serious matter indeed ! "[94-count paul] Soon [they]1562-they were bowling along [a quiet , sunny street]1563-a quiet , sunny street , edged with high walls overhung with trees . [The carriage]749-the carriage drew up . [Count Paul]94-count paul jumped out and gave [Sylvia]67-sylvia [his]94-count paul hand . Huge iron doors , that looked as if they could shut out [an invading army]1569-an invading army , were flung open , and after a moment 's pause , [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul led [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia across the threshold of [the historic Hôtel d'Eglemont]1570-the historic hôtel d'eglemont . [She]67-sylvia had never seen , [she]67-sylvia had never imagined , such pomp , such solemn state , as that which greeted [her]67-sylvia , and there came across [her]67-sylvia a childish wish that [Anna Wolsky]72-anna and [the Wachners]114-the wachners could witness the scene — [the hall]635-the hall hung with tapestries given to [an ancestor of [the Duc]1573-the duc]1572-an ancestor of the duc d'Eglemont by [Louis the Fourteenth]128-louis the fourteenth , [the line of [powdered footmen]1575-powdered footmen]1574-the line of powdered footmen , and [the solemn major - domo]1576-the solemn major - domo who ushered [them]1577-them up the wide staircase , at the head of which there stood [a slender , white - clad young woman]1578-a slender , white - clad young woman , with a sweet , eager face . This was the first time [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia had met [a duchess]1579-a duchess , and [she]67-sylvia was perhaps a little surprised to see how very unpretentious [a duchess]1579-a duchess could be ! And then , after [they]1582-they had lunched in [an octagon room of which each panel had been painted by [Van Loo]129-van loo]1583-an octagon room of which each panel had been painted by van loo , and which opened on [a garden where [the green glades]1585-the green glades and high trees looked as if [they]1582-they must be far from [a great city]1586-a great city]1584-a garden where the green glades and high trees looked as if they must be far from a great city , there suddenly glided in [a tiny old lady]1587-a tiny old lady , dressed in a sweeping black gown and little frilled lace cap . "[67-sylvia] [She]67-sylvia stopped abruptly , for [the Count]619-the count and [[his]619-the count little , fairy - like godmother]1592-his little , fairy - like godmother had turned round , and were now coming towards [them]1593-them . " Permit [me]1595-the old lady to embrace [you]67-sylvia , "[1595-the old lady] [she]1595-the old lady exclaimed suddenly . " [You]67-sylvia are [a very pretty creature]3426-a very pretty creature !
