[Chester]152-chester that morning for the first time in [his]152-chester well - balanced life felt not only ill but horribly depressed . [He]152-chester had come back to [the Pension Malfait]2808-the pension malfait the night before feeling quite well , and as cheerful as [his]152-chester disapproval of [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia 's proceedings at [the Casino]2652-the casino allowed [him]152-chester to be . And while thoroughly disapproving , [he]152-chester had yet — such being human nature — been glad that [Sylvia]67-sylvia had won and not lost ! [The Wachners]114-the wachners had offered to drive [him]152-chester back to [[his]152-chester pension]4375-his pension , and [he]152-chester had accepted , for it was very late , and [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , in spite of [her]67-sylvia [Fritz]112-l'ami fritz 's losses , had insisted on taking [a carriage]1344-a carriage [home]400-home . And then , though [he]152-chester had begun by going to sleep , [Chester]152-chester had waked at the end of an hour to feel [himself]152-chester encompassed , environed , oppressed by the perception — it was far more than a sensation — that [he]152-chester was no longer alone . [He]152-chester sat up in bed and struck a match , at once longing and fearing to see a form,—the semblance of [a human being]4378-a human being — rise out of the darkness . But all [he]152-chester saw , when [he]152-chester had lighted the candle which stood on the table by [his]152-chester bed , was [the barely furnished room which , even in this poor and wavering light , had so cheerful and commonplace an appearance]4379-the barely furnished room which , even in this poor and wavering light , had so cheerful and commonplace an appearance . Owing no doubt to [his]152-chester excellent physical condition , as well as to [his]152-chester good conscience , [Chester]152-chester was [a fearless man]4380-a fearless man . A week ago [he]152-chester would have laughed to scorn the notion that [the dead]4381-the dead ever revisit [the earth]4382-the earth , as so many of [us]4383-us believe [they]4381-the dead do , but the four nights [he]152-chester had spent at [the Pension Malfait]34-the pension malfait , had shaken [his]152-chester conviction that "[0-i] [dead men]2193-dead men rise up never . " Most reluctantly [he]152-chester had come to the conclusion that [the Pension Malfait]34-the pension malfait was haunted . And the feeling of unease did not vanish even after [he]152-chester had taken [his]152-chester bath in [the queer bath - room]4384-the queer bath - room , of which [the Malfaits]145-the malfaits were so proud , or later , when [he]152-chester had eaten the excellent breakfast provided for [him]152-chester . On the contrary , the thought of going up to [[his]152-chester bed - room]3267-his bed - room , even in broad daylight , filled [him]152-chester with a kind of shrinking fear . [He]152-chester told [himself]152-chester angrily that this kind of thing could not go on . The sleepless nights made [him]152-chester ill — [he]152-chester who never was ill ; also [he]152-chester was losing precious days of [his]152-chester short holiday , while doing no good to [himself]152-chester and no good to [Sylvia]67-sylvia . Sending for [the hotel - keeper]449-the hotel - keeper , [he]152-chester curtly told [him]449-the hotel - keeper that [he]152-chester meant to leave [Lacville]20-lacville that evening . [M. Malfait]103-m. malfait expressed much sorrow and regret . Was [M'sieur]151-m'sieur not comfortable ? Was there anything [he]152-chester could do to prolong [[his]152-chester English guest]4387-his english guest 's stay ? No , [M'sieur]151-m'sieur had every reason to be satisfied , but — but had [M. Malfait]103-m. malfait ever had any complaints of noises in [the bed - room occupied by [[his]103-m. malfait English guest]4387-his english guest]4388-the bed - room occupied by his english guest ? [The Frenchman]535-the frenchman 's surprise and discomfiture seemed quite sincere ; but [Chester]152-chester , looking into [his]152-chester face , suspected that the wondering protests , the assertion that [this particular bed - room]4391-this particular bed - room was the quietest in [the house]579-the house , were not sincere . In this , however [he]152-chester wronged poor [M. Malfait]103-m. malfait . [Chester]152-chester went [upstairs]246-upstairs and packed . There seemed to be a kind of finality in the act . If [she]67-sylvia knew [he]152-chester was ready to start that night , [Sylvia]67-sylvia would not be able to persuade [him]152-chester to stay on , as [she]67-sylvia probably would try to do . [The Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu looked wretched , preoccupied , and gloomy — as well [he]99-the comte de virieu might do , considering the large sum of money [he]99-the comte de virieu had lost last night . As for [Sylvia]69-sylvia — yes , there could be no doubt about it — [she]69-sylvia had been crying ! [She]67-sylvia will only stay a very few moments , as [she]67-sylvia has to be at [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac by ten o'clock . " [The woman]311-the woman turned and threw open the door of [the dining - room]577-the dining - room . Then [she]311-the woman struck a match , and lighted a lamp which stood on the table . [Sylvia]67-sylvia , as is often the case with [those who have been much thrown with [French people]494-french people]4468-those who have been much thrown with french people , could understand French much better than [she]67-sylvia could speak it , and what [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia had just hissed out in rapid , mumbling tones , surprised and puzzled [her]67-sylvia . It was quite untrue that [she]67-sylvia , [Sylvia]67-sylvia , had to be back at [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac by ten o'clock — for the matter of that , [she]67-sylvia could stay out as long and as late as [she]67-sylvia liked . Then , again , although the arrangement that [she]67-sylvia should come to supper at [the Châlet des Muguets]3173-the châlet des muguets to - night had been made that afternoon , [the Wachners]114-the wachners had been [home]400-home , but [they]114-the wachners had evidently forgotten to tell [[their]114-the wachners servant]4473-their servant that [they]114-the wachners were expecting [a visitor]4474-a visitor , for only two places were laid in [the little dining - room into which [they]114-the wachners all three walked on entering [the house]579-the house]4475-the little dining - room into which they all three walked on entering the house . Propped up against the now lighted lamp was a letter addressed to [Monsieur Polperro]137-monsieur polperro in a peculiar , large handwriting . [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz , again uttering that queer guttural exclamation , snatched up the envelope , and hurriedly put it into [his]112-l'ami fritz breast - pocket . "[0-i] [I]0-i brought that letter out of [[M'sieur]151-m'sieur 's bed - room]2241-m'sieur 's bed - room , " observed [the day - servant]3720-the day - servant , cringingly . "[0-i] [I]0-i feared [M'sieur]151-m'sieur had forgotten it ! Would [M'sieur]151-m'sieur like [me]0-i to take it to [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac on [my]0-i way [home]400-home ? " "[151-m'sieur] No , " said [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner , shortly . "[151-m'sieur] There is no need for [you]2244-you to do that ; [Madame Bailey]67-sylvia will kindly take it for [me]0-i . " And again [Sylvia]67-sylvia felt surprised . Surely [he]111-monsieur wachner had said — or was it [Madame Wachner?—that]67-sylvia [they]4478-they had arranged for [a man]234-a man to call for it . [[His]111-monsieur wachner wife]455-his wife shouted out [his]111-monsieur wachner name imperiously from [the dark passage]4481-the dark passage , "[112-l'ami fritz] [Fritz]112-l'ami fritz ! [Fritz]112-l'ami fritz ! Come here a moment ; [I]0-i want [you]112-l'ami fritz . " [He]111-monsieur wachner hurried out of [the room]194-the room , and [Sylvia]67-sylvia and [the servant]719-the servant were thus left alone together for a few moments in [the dining - room]577-the dining - room . [The woman]311-the woman went to the buffet and took up a plate ; [she]311-the woman came and placed it noisily on the table , and , under cover of the sound [she]311-the woman made , "[0-i] Do not stay [here]2519-here , [Madame]2550-madame , " [she]311-the woman whispered , thrusting [her]311-the woman wrinkled , sharp - featured face close to [the Englishwoman]1141-the englishwoman 's . "[2550-madame] Come away with [me]0-i ! Say [you]2550-madame want [me]0-i to wait a bit and conduct [you]2550-madame back to [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac . " [Sylvia]67-sylvia stared at [her]311-the woman distrustfully . [This femme de ménage]4487-this femme de ménage had a disagreeable face ; there was a cunning , avaricious look in [her]311-the woman eyes , or so [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey fancied ; no doubt [she]311-the woman remembered the couple of francs which had been given to [her]311-the woman , or rather extorted by [her]311-the woman , on the occasion of [the English lady]4488-the english lady 's last visit to [the Châlet des Muguets]3173-the châlet des muguets . "[2550-madame] [I]0-i will not say more , " [the servant]719-the servant went on , speaking very quickly , and under [her]0-i breath . "[2550-madame] But [I]0-i am [an honest woman]2605-an honest woman , and [these people]2776-these people frighten [me]0-i . Still , [I]0-i am [not one to want embarrassments with the police]2250-not one to want embarrassments with the police . " And [Sylvia]67-sylvia suddenly remembered that those were exactly the words which had been uttered by [[Anna Wolsky]72-anna 's landlady]4491-anna wolsky 's landlady in connection with [Anna]72-anna 's disappearance . How frightened [French people]494-french people seemed to be of [the police]3161-the police ! There came the sound of steps in [the passage]1347-the passage , and [the Frenchwoman]343-the frenchwoman moved away quickly from [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's side . [She]343-the frenchwoman took up the plate [she]343-the frenchwoman had just placed on the table , and to [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's mingled disgust and amusement began rubbing it vigorously with [her]343-the frenchwoman elbow . [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner entered [the room]194-the room . "[2250-not one to want embarrassments with the police] That will do , that will do , [Annette]168-annette , " [he]111-monsieur wachner said patronisingly . "[168-annette] Come here , [[my]0-i good woman]2251-my good woman ! " Without looking again at [Sylvia]67-sylvia [the woman]311-the woman went out of [the room]194-the room , and a moment later the front door slammed behind [her]311-the woman . "[151-m'sieur] [[My]0-i wife]2654-my wife discovered that it is [Annette]168-annette 's fête day to - morrow , and gave [her]2654-my wife a trifle . But [she]2654-my wife was evidently not satisfied , and no doubt that was why [she]2654-my wife stayed on to - night , " observed [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner solemnly . [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia now came in . [She]67-sylvia had taken off [her]67-sylvia bonnet and changed [her]67-sylvia elastic - sided boots for easy slippers . "[2654-my wife] Oh , [those French people]3193-those french people ! " [she]67-sylvia exclaimed . "[3193-those french people] How greedy [they]3193-those french people are for money ! But — well , [Annette]168-annette has earned [her]168-annette present very fairly — " [She]67-sylvia shrugged [her]67-sylvia shoulders . "[168-annette] May [I]0-i go and take off [my]0-i hat ? " asked [Sylvia]67-sylvia ; [she]67-sylvia left [the room]194-the room before [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia could answer [her]67-sylvia , and hurried down [the short , dark passage]4500-the short , dark passage . The door of [the moonlit kitchen]4501-the moonlit kitchen was ajar , and to [her]67-sylvia surprise [she]67-sylvia saw that a large trunk , corded and even labelled , stood in the middle of the floor . Close to the trunk was a large piece of sacking — and by it another coil of thick rope . Was it possible that [the Wachners]114-the wachners , too , were leaving [Lacville]20-lacville ? If so , how very odd of [them]114-the wachners not to have told [her]67-sylvia ! As [she]67-sylvia opened the door of [the bed - room]4502-the bed - room [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia waddled up behind [her]67-sylvia . "[168-annette] Wait a moment ! " [she]67-sylvia cried . "[168-annette] Or perhaps , [dear friend]2524-dear friend , [you]2524-dear friend do not want a light ? [You]2524-dear friend see , [we]2256-we have been rather upset to - day , for [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz has to go away for two or three days , and that is a great affair ! [We]2256-we are so very seldom separated . ' [Darby]169-darby and [Joan]170-joan , ' is not that what [English people]587-english people would call [us]2256-we ? " "[169-darby] The moon is so bright [I]0-i can see quite well , " [Sylvia]67-sylvia was taking off [her]67-sylvia hat ; [she]67-sylvia put it , together with a little fancy bag in which [she]67-sylvia kept the loose gold [she]67-sylvia played with at the gambling tables , on [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia 's bed . [She]67-sylvia felt vaguely uncomfortable , for even as [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia had spoken [she]67-sylvia had become aware that [the bed - room]4502-the bed - room was almost entirely cleared of everything belonging to [[its]4502-the bed - room occupants]4504-its occupants . However , [the Wachners]114-the wachners , like [Anna Wolsky]72-anna , had the right to go away without telling [anyone]2713-anyone of [their]114-the wachners intention . As [they]114-the wachners came back into [the dining - room]577-the dining - room together , [[Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey 's host]4507-mrs. bailey 's host , who was already sitting down at table , looked up . "[169-darby] Words ! Words ! Words ! " [he]4507-mrs. bailey 's host exclaimed harshly . "[169-darby] Instead of talking so much why do [you]2258-you not both come here and eat [your]2258-you suppers ? [I]0-i am very hungry . " [Sylvia]67-sylvia had never heard [the odd , silent man]4508-the odd , silent man speak in such a tone before , but [[his]4507-mrs. bailey 's host wife]455-his wife answered quite good - humouredly , "[0-i] [You]2258-you forget , [Fritz]112-l'ami fritz , that [the cabman]3873-the cabman is coming . " And sure enough , within a moment of [her]455-his wife saying those words there came a sound of shuffling footsteps on [the garden path]4510-the garden path . [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner got up and went out of [the room]194-the room . [He]111-monsieur wachner opened the front door , and [Sylvia]67-sylvia overheard a few words of the colloquy between [[her]67-sylvia host]4512-her host and [[his]111-monsieur wachner messenger]4513-his messenger . [You]2258-you will come for [us]2260-us — [you]2258-you will come , that is , for [me"—Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner raised [his]111-monsieur wachner voice—"to[151-m'sieur] - morrow morning at half - past six . [I]0-i desire to catch [the 7.10 train]2262-the 7.10 train to [Paris]1-paris . " There was a jingle of silver , and then [Sylvia]67-sylvia caught [the man]185-the man 's answering , "[0-i] Merci , c'est entendu , [M'sieur]151-m'sieur . " But [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz did not come back at once to [the dining - room]577-the dining - room . [He]112-l'ami fritz went out into [the garden]2749-the garden and accompanied [the man]185-the man down to the gate . When [he]112-l'ami fritz came back again [he]112-l'ami fritz put a large key on the dining - table . "[151-m'sieur] There ! " [he]112-l'ami fritz said , with a grunt of satisfaction . "[151-m'sieur] Now there will be nothing to disturb [us]2260-us any more . " [[They]2260-us all three]4518-they all three sat down at the round dining - table . To [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's surprise a very simple meal was set out before [them]2260-us . There was only one small dish of galantine . When [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia had been to supper with [the Wachners]114-the wachners before , there had always been two or three tempting cold dishes , and some dainty friandises as well , the whole evidently procured from [the excellent confectioner who drives such a roaring trade at [Lacville]20-lacville]4519-the excellent confectioner who drives such a roaring trade at lacville . To - night , in addition to the few slices of galantine , there was only a little fruit . Then a very odd thing happened . [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz helped first [[his]112-l'ami fritz wife]455-his wife and [himself]112-l'ami fritz largely , then [Sylvia]67-sylvia more frugally . It was perhaps a slight matter , the more so that [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner was notoriously forgetful , being ever , according to [[his]112-l'ami fritz wife]455-his wife , absorbed in [his]112-l'ami fritz calculations and "[151-m'sieur] systems . " But all the same , this extraordinary lack of good manners on [[her]67-sylvia host]4512-her host 's part added to [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's feeling of strangeness and discomfort . Indeed , [the Wachners]1882-the wachners were both very unlike [their]1882-the wachners usual selves this evening . [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia had suddenly become very serious , [her]67-sylvia stout red face was set in rather grim , grave lines ; and twice , as [Sylvia]67-sylvia was eating the little piece of galantine which had been placed on [her]67-sylvia plate by [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz , [she]67-sylvia looked up and caught [[her]67-sylvia hostess]1179-her hostess 's eyes fixed on [her]67-sylvia with a curious , alien scrutiny . When [they]1882-the wachners had almost finished the meat , [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia suddenly exclaimed in French . "[112-l'ami fritz] [Fritz]112-l'ami fritz ! [You]112-l'ami fritz have forgotten to mix the salad ! Whatever made [you]112-l'ami fritz forget such an important thing ? [You]112-l'ami fritz will find what is necessary in the drawer behind [you]112-l'ami fritz . " [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner made no answer . [He]111-monsieur wachner got up and pulled the drawer of the buffet open . Taking out of it a wooden spoon and fork , [he]111-monsieur wachner came back to the table and began silently mixing the salad . The two last times [Sylvia]67-sylvia had been at [the Châlet des Muguets]3173-the châlet des muguets , [[her]67-sylvia host]4512-her host , in deference to [her]67-sylvia English taste , had put a large admixture of vinegar in the salad dressing , but this time [she]67-sylvia saw that [he]111-monsieur wachner soused the lettuce - leaves with oil . At last , "[112-l'ami fritz] Will [you]112-l'ami fritz have some salad , [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey ? " [he]111-monsieur wachner said brusquely , and in English . [He]111-monsieur wachner spoke English far better than did [[his]111-monsieur wachner wife]455-his wife . "[71-mrs. bailey] No , " [she]67-sylvia said . "[71-mrs. bailey] Not to - night , thank [you]112-l'ami fritz ! " And [Sylvia]67-sylvia , smiling , looked across at [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , expecting to see in [the older woman]349-the older woman 's face a humorous appreciation of the fact that [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz had forgotten [her]349-the older woman well - known horror of oil . [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey 's dislike of the favourite French salad - dressing ingredient had long been a joke among [the three]4322-the three , nay , among [the four]1105-the four , for [Anna Wolsky]72-anna had been there the last time [Sylvia]67-sylvia had had supper with [the Wachners]114-the wachners . It had been such a merry meal ! To - night no meaning smile met [hers]67-sylvia ; instead [she]67-sylvia only saw that odd , grave , considering look on [[her]67-sylvia hostess]1179-her hostess 's face . Suddenly [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia held out [her]67-sylvia plate across the table , and [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz heaped it up with the oily salad . [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia 's plate was empty , but [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner did not seem to notice that [[his]111-monsieur wachner guest]4532-his guest lacked anything . And at last , to [her]67-sylvia extreme astonishment , [she]67-sylvia suddenly saw [him]111-monsieur wachner take up one of the two pieces of meat remaining on the dish , and , leaning across , drop it on [[his]111-monsieur wachner wife]455-his wife 's plate . Then [he]111-monsieur wachner helped [himself]111-monsieur wachner to the last remaining morsel . It was such a trifling thing really , and due of course to [[her]67-sylvia host]4512-her host 's singular absent - mindedness ; yet , even so , taken in connection with both [the Wachners]114-the wachners ' silence and odd manner , this lack of the commonest courtesy struck [Sylvia]67-sylvia with a kind of fear — with fear and with pain . [She]67-sylvia felt so hurt that the tears came into [her]67-sylvia eyes . There was a long moment 's pause — then , "[112-l'ami fritz] Do [you]2263-you not feel well , " asked [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia harshly , "[2263-you] or are [you]2263-you grieving for [the Comte de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu ? " [Her]0-i voice had become guttural , full of coarse and cruel malice , and even as [she]0-i spoke [she]0-i went on eating voraciously . [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia pushed [her]67-sylvia chair back , and rose to [her]67-sylvia feet . "[99-the comte de virieu] [I]0-i should like to go [home]400-home now , " [she]0-i said quietly , "[0-i] for it is getting late,"—her voice shook a little . [She]0-i was desperately afraid of disgracing [herself]0-i by a childish outburst of tears . "[0-i] [I]0-i can make [my]0-i way back quite well without [[Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner 's escort]2265-monsieur wachner 's escort . " [She]0-i saw [[her]0-i host]4512-her host shrug [his]4512-her host shoulders . [He]4512-her host made a grimace at [[his]4512-her host wife]455-his wife ; it expressed annoyance , nay , more , extreme disapproval . [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia also got up . [She]67-sylvia wiped [her]67-sylvia mouth with [her]67-sylvia napkin , and then laid [her]67-sylvia hand on [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's shoulder . "[2265-monsieur wachner 's escort] Come , come , " [she]67-sylvia exclaimed , and this time [she]67-sylvia spoke quite kindly , "[2265-monsieur wachner 's escort] [you]2266-you must not be cross with [me]0-i , [dear friend]2524-dear friend ! [I]0-i was only laughing , [I]0-i was only what [you]2266-you call in [England]8-england ' teasing . ' The truth is [I]0-i am very vexed and upset that [our]2268-our supper is not better . [I]0-i told [that fool Frenchwoman]2269-that fool frenchwoman to get in something really nice , and [she]2269-that fool frenchwoman disobeyed [me]0-i ! [I]0-i was ' ungry , too , for [I]0-i ' ad no déjeuner to - day , and that makes [one ' ollow]2270-one ' ollow , does it not ? But now [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz is going to make [us]2268-our some good coffee ! After [we]2268-our ' ave ' ad it [you]2266-you shall go away if so is [your]2266-you wish , but [my]0-i ' usband will certainly accompany [you]2266-you — " "[0-i] Most certainly [I]0-i will do so ; [you]2266-you will not move — no , not a single step — without [me]0-i , " said [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner solemnly . And then [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia burst out into a sudden peal of laughter — laughter which was infectious . [Sylvia]67-sylvia smiled too , and sat down again . After all , as [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu had truly said , not once , but many times , [the Wachners]114-the wachners were not [refined people]4537-refined people — but [they]114-the wachners were kind and very good - natured . And then [she]67-sylvia , [Sylvia]67-sylvia , was tired and low - spirited to - night — no doubt [she]67-sylvia had imagined the change in [their]114-the wachners manner , which had so surprised and hurt [her]67-sylvia . [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia was quite [her]67-sylvia old self again ; just now [she]67-sylvia was engaged in heaping all the cherries which were in the dessert dish on [[her]67-sylvia guest]1213-her guest 's plate , in spite of [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's eager protest . [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz got up and left [the room]194-the room . [He]112-l'ami fritz was going into [the kitchen]3190-the kitchen to make the coffee . "[152-chester] [Mr. Chester]152-chester was telling [me]0-i of [your]152-chester valuable pearls , " said [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia pleasantly . "[152-chester] [I]0-i was surprised ! What a lot of money to ' ang round one 's neck ! But it is worth it if one ' as so lovely a neck as ' as [the beautiful Sylvia]67-sylvia ! May [I]0-i look at [your]152-chester pearls , [dear friend]2524-dear friend ? Or do [you]152-chester never take them off ? " [Sylvia]67-sylvia unclasped the string of pearls and laid it on the table . "[152-chester] Yes , they are rather nice , " [she]0-i said modestly . "[152-chester] [I]0-i always wear them , even at night . [Many people]2665-many people have a knot made between each pearl , for that , of course , makes the danger of losing them much less should the string break . But [mine]0-i are not knotted , for [a lady]2887-a lady once told [me]0-i that it made the pearls hang much less prettily ; [she]2887-a lady said it would be quite safe if [I]0-i had them restrung every six months . So that is what [I]0-i do . [I]0-i had them restrung just before coming to [France]18-france . " [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia reverentially took up the pearls in [her]67-sylvia large hand ; [she]67-sylvia seemed to be weighing them . "[0-i] How heavy they are , " [she]67-sylvia said at length , and now [she]67-sylvia spoke French . "[0-i] Yes , " said [Sylvia]67-sylvia , "[0-i] [you]152-chester can always tell a real pearl by its weight . " "[152-chester] And to think , " went on [[her]67-sylvia hostess]1179-her hostess musingly , "[152-chester] that each of these tiny balls is worth — how much is it worth?—at least five or six hundred francs , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[0-i] Yes , " said [Sylvia]67-sylvia again , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm glad to say they have increased in value during the last few years . [You]152-chester see , pearls are the only really fashionable gems just now . " "[152-chester] And they can not be identified like other fine jewels , " observed [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , "[152-chester] but [I]0-i suppose they are worth more together than separately ? " [she]67-sylvia was still speaking in that thoughtful , considering tone . "[152-chester] Oh , [I]0-i do n't know that , " said [Sylvia]67-sylvia , smiling . "[152-chester] Each separate pearl is worth a good deal , but still [I]0-i daresay [you]152-chester are right , for these are beautifully matched . [I]0-i got them , by a piece of great luck , without having to pay — well , what [I]0-i suppose [one]2530-one would call [the middle - man]2275-the middle - man 's profit ! [I]0-i just paid what [I]0-i should have done at a good [London]4-london sale . " "[0-i] And [you]0-i paid?—seven — eight ' undred pounds ? " asked [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , this time in English , and fixing [her]67-sylvia small , dark eyes on [the fair Englishwoman]4542-the fair englishwoman 's face . "[0-i] Oh , rather more than that . " [Sylvia]67-sylvia grew a little red . "[0-i] But as [I]0-i said just now , they are always increasing in value . Even [Mr. Chester]152-chester , who did not approve of [my]0-i getting these pearls , admits that [I]0-i made a good bargain . " Through the open door [she]67-sylvia thought [she]67-sylvia heard [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner coming back down [the passage]1347-the passage . So [she]67-sylvia suddenly took the pearls out of [the other woman]197-the other woman 's hand and clasped the string about [her]197-the other woman neck again . [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz came into [the room]194-the room . [He]112-l'ami fritz was holding rather awkwardly a little tray on which were two cups — one a small cup , the other a large cup , both filled to the brim with black coffee . [He]112-l'ami fritz put the small cup before [[his]112-l'ami fritz guest]4532-his guest , the large cup before [[his]112-l'ami fritz wife]455-his wife . "[152-chester] [I]0-i hope [you]0-i do not mind having a small cup , " [he]112-l'ami fritz said solemnly . "[0-i] [I]0-i remember that [you]0-i do not care to take a great deal of coffee , so [I]0-i have given [you]0-i the small cup . " [Sylvia]67-sylvia looked up . "[0-i] Oh dear ! " [she]0-i exclaimed , "[0-i] [I]0-i ought to have told [you]0-i before [you]0-i made it , [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner — but [I]0-i wo n't have any coffee to - night . The last time [I]0-i took some [I]0-i lay awake all night . " "[0-i] Oh , but [you]0-i must take coffee ! " [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia spoke good - humouredly , but with great determination . "[0-i] The small amount [you]0-i have in that little cup will not hurt [you]0-i ; and besides it is a special coffee , [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz 's own mixture"—she laughed heartily . And again ? [Sylvia]67-sylvia noticed that [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner looked at [[his]111-monsieur wachner wife]455-his wife with a fixed , rather angry look , as much as to say , "[112-l'ami fritz] Why are [you]0-i always laughing ? Why can not [you]0-i be serious sometimes ? " "[0-i] But to - night , honestly , [I]0-i would really rather not have any coffee ! " [Sylvia]67-sylvia had suddenly seen a vision of [herself]67-sylvia lying wide awake during long dark hours — hours which , as [she]67-sylvia knew by experience , generally bring to the sleepless , worrying thoughts . "[0-i] No , no , [I]0-i will not have any coffee to - night , " [she]67-sylvia repeated . "[0-i] Yes , yes , [dear friend]2524-dear friend , [you]0-i really must , " [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia spoke very persuasively . "[0-i] [I]0-i should be truly sorry if [you]0-i did not take this coffee . Indeed , it would make [me]0-i think [you]0-i were angry with [us]2277-us because of the very bad supper [we]2277-us had given [you]0-i ! [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz would not have taken the trouble to make coffee for [[his]112-l'ami fritz old wife]3328-his old wife . [He]112-l'ami fritz has made it for [you]0-i , only for [you]0-i ; [he]112-l'ami fritz will be hurt if [you]0-i do not take it ! " The coffee did look very tempting and fragrant . [Sylvia]67-sylvia had always disliked coffee in [England]8-england , but somehow French coffee was quite different ; it had quite another taste from that of the mixture which [the ladies of [Market Dalling]10-market dalling]4549-the ladies of market dalling pressed on [[their]4549-the ladies of market dalling guests]4550-their guests at [their]4549-the ladies of market dalling dinner - parties . [She]67-sylvia lifted the pretty little cup to [her]67-sylvia lips — but the coffee , this coffee of [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz , [his]112-l'ami fritz special mixture , as [[his]112-l'ami fritz wife]455-his wife had termed it , had a rather curious taste , it was slightly bitter — decidedly not so nice as that which [she]67-sylvia was accustomed to drink each day after déjeuner at [the Villa du Lac]2645-the villa du lac . Surely it would be very foolish to risk a bad night for a small cup of indifferent coffee ? [She]67-sylvia put the cup down , and pushed it away . "[112-l'ami fritz] Please do not ask [me]0-i to take it , " [she]67-sylvia said firmly . "[112-l'ami fritz] It really is very bad for [me]0-i ! " [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia shrugged [her]67-sylvia shoulders with an angry gesture . "[112-l'ami fritz] So be it , " [she]0-i said , and then imperiously , "[112-l'ami fritz] [Fritz]112-l'ami fritz , will [you]112-l'ami fritz please come with [me]0-i for a moment into [the next room]2279-the next room ? [I]0-i have something to ask [you]112-l'ami fritz . " [He]112-l'ami fritz got up and silently obeyed [[his]112-l'ami fritz wife]455-his wife . Before leaving [the room]194-the room [he]112-l'ami fritz slipped the key of the garden gate into [his]112-l'ami fritz trousers pocket . A moment later [Sylvia]67-sylvia , left alone , could hear [them]4555-they talking eagerly to [one another]191-one another in that strange , unknown tongue in which [they]4555-they sometimes — not often — addressed [one another]191-one another . [She]67-sylvia got up from [her]67-sylvia chair , seized with a sudden , eager desire to slip away before [they]4555-they came back . For a moment [she]67-sylvia even thought of leaving [the house]579-the house without waiting for [her]67-sylvia hat and little fancy bag ; and then , with a strange sinking of the heart [she]67-sylvia remembered that the white gate was locked , and that [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz had now the key of it in [his]112-l'ami fritz pocket . But in no case would [Sylvia]67-sylvia have had time to do what [she]67-sylvia had thought of doing , for a moment later [[her]67-sylvia host]4512-her host and [hostess]4560-hostess were back in [the room]194-the room . [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia sat down again at the dining - table , "[0-i] One moment ! " [she]67-sylvia exclaimed , rather breathlessly . "[0-i] Just wait till [I]0-i ' ave finished [my]0-i coffee , [[Sylvia]67-sylvia dear]2280-sylvia dear , and then [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz will escort [you]67-sylvia ' ome . " Rather unwillingly , [Sylvia]67-sylvia again sat down . [Monsieur Wachner]111-monsieur wachner was paying no attention either to [[his]111-monsieur wachner guest]4532-his guest or to [[his]111-monsieur wachner wife]455-his wife . [He]111-monsieur wachner took up the chair on which [he]111-monsieur wachner had been sitting , and placed it out of the way near the door . Then [he]111-monsieur wachner lifted the lighted lamp off the table and put it on the buffet . As [he]111-monsieur wachner did so , [Sylvia]67-sylvia , looking up , saw the shadow of [his]111-monsieur wachner tall , lank figure thrown grotesquely , hugely , against the opposite wall of [the room]194-the room . "[112-l'ami fritz] Now take the cloth off the table , " [he]111-monsieur wachner said curtly . And [[his]111-monsieur wachner wife]455-his wife , gulping down the last drops of [her]455-his wife coffee , got up and obeyed [him]111-monsieur wachner . [Sylvia]67-sylvia suddenly realised that [they]4566-they were getting ready for something — that [they]4566-they wanted [the room]194-the room cleared . As with quick , deft fingers [she]67-sylvia folded up the cloth , [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia exclaimed , "[112-l'ami fritz] As [you]2281-you are not taking any coffee , [Sylvia]67-sylvia , perhaps it is time for [you]2281-you now to get up and go away . " [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia looked across at [the speaker]359-the speaker , and reddened deeply . [She]67-sylvia felt very angry . Never in the course of [her]67-sylvia pleasant , easy , prosperous life had [anyone]2713-anyone ventured to dismiss [her]67-sylvia in this fashion from [[their]2713-anyone house]1877-their house . [She]67-sylvia rose , for the second time during the course of [her]67-sylvia short meal , to [her]67-sylvia feet — And then , in a flash , there occurred that which transformed [her]67-sylvia anger into agonised fear — fear and terror . The back of [her]67-sylvia neck had been grazed by something sharp and cold , and as [she]67-sylvia gave a smothered cry [she]67-sylvia saw that [her]67-sylvia string of pearls had parted in two . The pearls were now falling quickly one by one , and rolling all over the floor . Instinctively [she]67-sylvia bent down , but as [she]67-sylvia did so [she]67-sylvia heard [the man behind [her]67-sylvia]4571-the man behind her make a quick movement . [She]67-sylvia straightened [herself]67-sylvia and looked sharply round . [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz was still holding in [his]112-l'ami fritz hand the small pair of nail scissors with which [he]112-l'ami fritz had snipped asunder [her]67-sylvia necklace ; with the other [he]112-l'ami fritz was in the act of taking out something from the drawer of the buffet . [She]67-sylvia suddenly saw what that something was . [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia 's nerves steadied ; [her]67-sylvia mind became curiously collected and clear . There had leapt on [her]67-sylvia the knowledge that [this man]3953-this man and [woman]485-woman meant to kill [her]67-sylvia — to kill [her]67-sylvia for the sake of the pearls which were still bounding about the floor , and for the comparatively small sum of money which [she]67-sylvia carried slung in the leather bag below [her]67-sylvia waist . [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz now stood staring at [her]67-sylvia . [He]112-l'ami fritz had put [his]112-l'ami fritz right hand — the hand holding the thing [he]112-l'ami fritz had taken out of the drawer — behind [his]112-l'ami fritz back . [He]112-l'ami fritz was very pale ; the sweat had broken out on [his]112-l'ami fritz sallow , thin face . For a horrible moment there floated across [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's sub - conscious mind the thought of [Anna Wolsky]72-anna , and of what [she]67-sylvia now knew to have been [Anna Wolsky]72-anna 's fate . But [she]67-sylvia put that thought , that awful knowledge , determinedly away from [her]67-sylvia . The instinct of self - preservation possessed [her]67-sylvia wholly . Already , in far less time than it would have taken to formulate the words , [she]67-sylvia had made up [her]67-sylvia mind to speak , and [she]67-sylvia knew exactly what [she]67-sylvia meant to say . "[67-sylvia] It does not matter about [my]0-i pearls , " [Sylvia]67-sylvia said , quietly . [Her]0-i voice shook a little , but otherwise [she]0-i spoke in [her]0-i usual tone . "[67-sylvia] If [you]2282-you are going into [Paris]1-paris to - morrow morning , perhaps [you]2282-you would take them to be restrung ? " [The man]185-the man looked questioningly across at [[his]185-the man wife]455-his wife . "[2282-you] Yes , that sounds a good plan , " [he]185-the man said , in [his]185-the man guttural voice . "[2282-you] No , " exclaimed [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia , decidedly , "[2282-you] that will not do at all ! [We]2283-we must not run that risk . The pearls must be found , now , at once ! Stoop ! " [she]0-i said imperiously . "[67-sylvia] Stoop , [Sylvia]67-sylvia ! Help [me]0-i to find [your]67-sylvia pearls ! " [She]0-i made a gesture as if [she]0-i also meant to bend down .... But [Sylvia Bailey]67-sylvia made no attempt to obey the sinister order . Slowly , warily [she]0-i edged [herself]0-i towards the closed window . At last [she]0-i stood with [her]0-i back to it — at bay . "[67-sylvia] No , " [she]0-i said quietly , "[67-sylvia] [I]0-i will not stoop to pick up [my]0-i pearls now , [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia . Is not that so , [Ami Fritz]110-ami fritz ? " and there was a tone of pleading , for the first time of pitiful fear , in [her]0-i soft voice . [She]0-i looked at [him]110-ami fritz piteously , [her]0-i large blue eyes wide open , dilated — "[110-ami fritz] It is not [[my]0-i husband]3073-my husband 's business to pick up [your]0-i pearls ! " exclaimed [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia harshly . [She]67-sylvia stepped forward and gripped [Sylvia]67-sylvia by the arm , pulling [her]67-sylvia violently forward . As [she]0-i did so [she]0-i made a sign to [[her]0-i husband]254-her husband , and [he]110-ami fritz pushed a chair quickly between [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey and the window . [Sylvia]67-sylvia had lost [her]67-sylvia point of vantage , but [she]67-sylvia was young and lithe ; [she]67-sylvia kept [her]67-sylvia feet . Nevertheless , [she]67-sylvia knew with a cold , reasoned knowledge that [she]67-sylvia was very near to death — that it was only a question of minutes,—unless — unless [she]67-sylvia could make [the man]185-the man and woman before [her]67-sylvia understand that [they]2285-you would gain far more money by allowing [her]67-sylvia to live than by killing [her]67-sylvia now , to - night , for the value of the pearls that lay scattered on the floor , and the small , the pitiably small sum on [her]67-sylvia person . "[110-ami fritz] If [you]2285-you will let [me]0-i go , " [she]0-i said , desperately , "[2285-you] [I]0-i swear [I]0-i will give [you]2285-you everything [I]0-i have in [the world]329-the world ! "[114-the wachners] If that is really true , " [he]152-chester said suddenly , "[114-the wachners] [I]0-i almost feel as if [I]0-i ought to go back to [Lacville]20-lacville to - night . [I]0-i suppose there are heaps of [trains]428-trains ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i might , at all events , wait till to - morrow morning , " said [Paul de Virieu]99-the comte de virieu , drily . [He]99-the comte de virieu also had suddenly experienced a thrill of that primitive passion , jealousy , which had surprised [Chester]152-chester but a few moments before . But [the Count]94-count paul was [a Frenchman]227-a frenchman . [He]94-count paul was familiar with the sensation — nay , [he]94-count paul welcomed it . It showed that [he]94-count paul was still young — still worthy to be one of [the great company of lovers]4616-the great company of lovers . [Sylvia]67-sylvia , [his]94-count paul "[0-i] petite amie Anglaise , " seemed to have come very near to [him]94-count paul in the last few moments . [He]94-count paul saw [her]67-sylvia blue eyes brim with tears at [his]94-count paul harsh words — [he]94-count paul thrilled as [he]94-count paul had thrilled with the overmastering impulse which had made [him]94-count paul take [her]67-sylvia into [his]94-count paul arms — [her]67-sylvia hand lay once more in [his]94-count paul hand , as it had lain , for a moment this morning . A vision rose before [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul — a vision of [Sylvia]67-sylvia and [himself]94-count paul living heart to heart in [one of [those small , stately manor - houses which are scattered throughout [Brittany]56-brittany]4618-those small , stately manor - houses which are scattered throughout brittany]4617-one of those small , stately manor - houses which are scattered throughout brittany . A sense of immeasurable loss came over [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul — But , no , [he]94-count paul had been right ! Quite right ! [He]94-count paul loved [Sylvia]67-sylvia far too well to risk making [her]67-sylvia as unhappy as [he]94-count paul would almost certainly be tempted to make [her]67-sylvia , if [she]67-sylvia became [[his]94-count paul wife]455-his wife . [He]94-count paul took off [his]94-count paul hat and remained silent for what seemed to [[his]94-count paul companion]3907-his companion quite a long time . "[619-the count] [They]2388-they swept on through [the town]785-the town , and so along [the dimly - lighted shady avenues with which even [Chester]79-chester had become so familiar during the last few days]2393-the dimly - lighted shady avenues with which even chester had become so familiar during the last few days . [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul sat with clenched hands , staring in front of [him]94-count paul . Remorse filled [his]94-count paul soul — remorse and anguish . If [Sylvia]67-sylvia had been done to death , as [he]94-count paul now had very little doubt [Anna Wolsky]72-anna had been done to death , then [he]94-count paul would die too . What was the vice which had meant all to [him]94-count paul for so many years compared to [his]94-count paul love for [Sylvia]67-sylvia ? [The gendarmes]2394-the gendarmes murmured together in quick , excited tones . [They]2394-the gendarmes scented that something really exciting , something that would perhaps lead to promotion , was going to happen . At last , as [the carriage]749-the carriage turned into [a dark road]2396-a dark road , [Count Paul]94-count paul suddenly began to talk , at the very top of [his]94-count paul voice . " Speak , [Mr. Chester]152-chester , speak as loud as [you]152-chester can ! Shout ! Say anything that [you]152-chester like ! " [We]4700-we are going to pay an evening call — what [you]4179-the other man in [England]8-england call an evening call ! " [I]185-the man have done it in six minutes ! "[185-the man] The horse was suddenly brought up short opposite the white gate . Was this where [the Wachners]114-the wachners lived ? [Chester]152-chester stooped down . [The place]211-the place looked very different now from what [it]211-the place had looked in the daylight . "[619-the count] In varying accents were returned the composed answers , " Oui , [M'sieur]2361-m'sieur . "[619-the count] There came a check , for the little gate was locked . [Chester]152-chester and [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul walked quickly up [the path]4226-the path . Suddenly a shaft of bright light pierced the moonlit darkness . " Qui va là ? [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul opened [his]94-count paul lips — but no sound came from [them]2425-them . [He]94-count paul turned the handle of the dining - room door , and then stopped short , for [he]94-count paul was amazed at the sight which met [his]94-count paul eyes . [Sylvia]67-sylvia was sitting at a round table ; behind [her]67-sylvia was the buffet , still laden with the remains of a simple meal . [Her]67-sylvia face was hidden in [her]67-sylvia hands , and [she]67-sylvia was trembling — shaking as though [she]67-sylvia had the ague . " Such a misfortune ! "[67-sylvia] [she]67-sylvia exclaimed in English . " Such a very great misfortune ! "[67-sylvia] [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul took a sudden step forward into [the room]194-the room . [He]94-count paul had just become aware of something which had made [him]94-count paul also feel what [English people]587-english people call " queer . "[94-count paul] That something had no business in [the dining - room]577-the dining - room , for it belonged to [the kitchen]3190-the kitchen — in fact it was a large wooden mallet of the kind used by [French cooks to beat meat tender]2436-french cooks to beat meat tender . Just now the club end of the mallet was sticking out of the drawer of the walnut - wood buffet . The drawer had evidently been pulled out askew , and had stuck — as is the way with drawers forming part of ill - made furniture . [Chester]79-chester came to the door of [the dining - room]577-the dining - room . [M. Wachner]162-m. wachner had detained [him]79-chester for a moment in [the hall]635-the hall , talking volubly , explaining how pleasant had been [their]2439-their little supper party till [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey had suddenly felt faint . [Chester]79-chester looked anxiously at [Sylvia]67-sylvia . [She]67-sylvia was oddly pale , all the colour drained from [her]67-sylvia face , but [she]67-sylvia seemed on quite good terms with [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia ! As for [that stout , good - natured looking woman]2440-that stout , good - natured looking woman , [she]67-sylvia also was unlike [her]67-sylvia placid smiling self , for [her]67-sylvia face looked red and puffy . But still [she]67-sylvia nodded pleasantly to [Chester]79-chester . It seemed to [the lawyer]4000-the lawyer inconceivable that [this commonplace couple]2442-this commonplace couple could have seriously meant to rob [[their]2442-this commonplace couple guest]2443-their guest . But there was that letter — that strange , sinister letter which purported to be from [Sylvia]67-sylvia ! Who had written that letter , and with what object in view ? [Chester]79-chester began to feel as if [he]79-chester was living through a very disagreeable , bewildering nightmare . But no scintilla of the horrible truth reached [his]79-chester cautious , well - balanced brain . The worst [he]79-chester suspected , and that only because of the inexplicable letter , was that [these people]2776-these people meant to extract money from [[their]2776-these people guest]2443-their guest and frighten [her]67-sylvia into leaving [Lacville]20-lacville the same night . " [Sylvia]67-sylvia , "[79-chester] [he]79-chester said rather shortly , " [I]79-chester suppose [we]2442-this commonplace couple ought to be going now . [L'Ami Fritz]112-l'ami fritz entered [the room]194-the room quietly . [She]67-sylvia had never thought to see the sky and the stars again . [They]2476-they were now moving very slowly , almost at a foot 's pace . [The driver]726-the driver was accustomed to people who suddenly decided to drive all the way back to [Paris]1-paris from [Lacville]20-lacville after an evening 's successful or , for the matter of that , unsuccessful play . [He]726-the driver had been very much relieved to see [[his]726-the driver two gentlemen]2478-his two gentlemen come back from [the châlet]1339-the châlet and to leave [the gendarmes]2394-the gendarmes behind . [He]726-the driver had no wish to get mixed up in a fracas , no wish , that is , to have any embarrassments with [the police]3161-the police . [They]2476-they drove on and on , into [the open country]3125-the open country ; through [dimly - lit , leafy thoroughfares]2483-dimly - lit , leafy thoroughfares , through long stretches of [market gardens]2484-market gardens , till [they]2476-they came on to [the outskirts of [the great city]2486-the great city]2485-the outskirts of the great city — and still [Sylvia]67-sylvia remained obstinately silent . "[94-count paul] [Chester]152-chester in the darkness felt [himself]152-chester flushing . With a diffident , awkward gesture [he]726-the driver took [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's hand in [his]726-the driver — and then [he]726-the driver uttered an exclamation of surprise and concern . The hand [he]726-the driver held was quite cold — cold and nerveless to the touch , as if all that constitutes life had gone out of it . " [[My]726-the driver dear girl]4748-my dear girl ! "[726-the driver] [he]726-the driver exclaimed . " [I]726-the driver 'm afraid [those people]4749-those people frightened [you]67-sylvia badly ? [I]726-the driver suppose [you]67-sylvia began to suspect [they]4749-those people meant to steal [your]67-sylvia pearls ? "[726-the driver] But [Sylvia]67-sylvia still remained obstinately silent . [She]67-sylvia did not want to speak , [she]67-sylvia only wanted to live . It was so strange to feel [oneself]2487-oneself alive — alive and whole at a time when [one had thought to be dead , having been done to death after an awful , disfiguring struggle]2488-one had thought to be dead , having been done to death after an awful , disfiguring struggle — for [Sylvia]67-sylvia had determined to struggle to the end with [[her]67-sylvia murderers]2489-her murderers . " [[My]94-count paul God]4750-my god ! "[94-count paul] muttered [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul . " Do [you]152-chester not understand , [Chester]152-chester , what happened to - night ? [They]2489-her murderers meant to kill [her]67-sylvia ! "[94-count paul] " To kill [her]67-sylvia ? "[152-chester] repeated [Chester]152-chester incredulously . Then there came over [him]152-chester a rush and glow of angry excitement . [Good God]147-god ! If that was the case [they]2489-her murderers ought to have driven back at once to [the Lacville police - station]2490-the lacville police - station ! " [Sylvia]67-sylvia ! "[94-count paul] [he]94-count paul exclaimed . " Rouse [yourself]67-sylvia , and tell [us]2489-her murderers what took place ! If what [the Count]619-the count says is true , something must be done , and at once ! "[94-count paul] [He]94-count paul turned to [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul : " [The police]3161-the police ought to take [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey 's full statement of all that occurred without any loss of time ! "[94-count paul] [All the lawyer in [him]94-count paul]2491-all the lawyer in him spoke angrily , agitatedly . [Sylvia]67-sylvia moved slightly . [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul could feel [her]67-sylvia shuddering by [his]94-count paul side . " Oh , [Bill]79-chester , let [me]67-sylvia try to forget ! "[67-sylvia] [she]67-sylvia moaned . And then , lifting up [her]67-sylvia voice , [she]67-sylvia wailed , " [They]3161-the police killed [Anna Wolsky]72-anna — "[67-sylvia] [Her]67-sylvia voice broke , and [she]67-sylvia began to sob convulsively . " [I]67-sylvia would not think of [her]72-anna — [I]67-sylvia forced [myself]67-sylvia not to think of [her]72-anna — but now [I]67-sylvia shall never , never think of [anyone else]1881-anyone else any more ! "[67-sylvia] [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul turned in the kindly darkness , and putting [his]94-count paul arm round [Sylvia]67-sylvia 's slender shoulders , [he]94-count paul tenderly drew [her]67-sylvia to [him]94-count paul . A passion of pity , of protective tenderness , filled [his]94-count paul heart , and suddenly lifted [him]94-count paul to a higher region than that in which [he]94-count paul had hitherto been content to dwell . " [You]67-sylvia must not say that , [ma chérie]4754-ma chérie , "[94-count paul] [he]94-count paul whispered , laying [his]94-count paul cheek to [hers]67-sylvia as tenderly as [he]94-count paul would have caressed [a child]247-a child , " it would be too cruel to [the living]4755-the living , to those who love [you]4754-ma chérie — who adore [you]4754-ma chérie . "[94-count paul] Then [he]94-count paul raised [his]94-count paul head , and , in a very different tone , [he]94-count paul exclaimed , " Do not be afraid , [Mr. Chester]152-chester , [those infamous people]4756-those infamous people shall not be allowed to escape ! [Poor Madame Wolsky]73-madame wolsky shall surely be avenged . But [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey will not be asked to make any statement , except in writing — in what [you]152-chester in [England]8-england call an affidavit . [You]152-chester do not realise , although [you]152-chester doubtless know , what [our]4757-our legal procedure is like . Not even in order to secure the guillotine for [Madame Wachner]67-sylvia and [[her]67-sylvia Fritz]4334-her fritz would [I]94-count paul expose [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey to the ordeal of [[our]4757-our French witness]4759-our french witness - box . "[94-count paul] " And how will it be possible to avoid it ? "[152-chester] asked [Chester]152-chester , in a low voice . [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul hesitated , then , leaning forward and holding [Sylvia]67-sylvia still more closely and protectively to [him]94-count paul , [he]94-count paul said very deliberately the fateful words [he]94-count paul had never thought to say , " [I]94-count paul have an announcement to make to [you]152-chester , [Mr. Chester]152-chester . It is one which [I]94-count paul trust will bring [me]94-count paul [your]152-chester true congratulations . [Mrs. Bailey]71-mrs. bailey is about to do [me]94-count paul the honour of becoming [[my]94-count paul wife]2654-my wife . "[94-count paul] [He]94-count paul waited a moment , then added very gravely , " [I]94-count paul am giving [her]67-sylvia an undertaking , a solemn promise by all [I]94-count paul hold most sacred , to abandon play — "[94-count paul] [Chester]152-chester felt a shock of amazement . How utterly mistaken , how blind [he]152-chester had been ! [He]152-chester had felt positively certain that [Sylvia]67-sylvia had refused [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul ; and [he]152-chester had been angered by the suspicion , nay , by what [he]152-chester had thought the sure knowledge , that the wise refusal had cost [her]67-sylvia pain . But [women]260-women are [extraordinary creatures]2494-extraordinary creatures , and so , for the matter of that , are [Frenchmen]604-frenchmen — Still , [his]152-chester feelings to [the man sitting opposite to [him]152-chester]4589-the man sitting opposite to him had undergone a complete change . [He]152-chester now liked — nay , [he]152-chester now respected — [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul . But for [the Count]619-the count , whom [he]152-chester had thought to be nothing more than [an effeminate dandy]2498-an effeminate dandy , [a hopeless gambler]2499-a hopeless gambler , where would [Sylvia]67-sylvia be now ? The unspoken answer to this question gave [Chester]152-chester a horrible inward tremor . [He]152-chester leant forward , and grasped [Paul de Virieu]94-count paul 's left hand . " [I]152-chester do congratulate [you]67-sylvia , "[152-chester] [he]152-chester said , simply and heartily ; " [you]67-sylvia deserve [your]67-sylvia great good fortune . "[152-chester] Then , to [Sylvia]67-sylvia , [he]152-chester added quietly , " [[My]152-chester dear]2500-my dear , it is to [him]619-the count [you]67-sylvia owe [your]67-sylvia life . "[152-chester]
